LDC_Translation_1: Day of Ashura: Today the Day of Ashura and the Remembrance of the Great Sacrifice of the Chief of Martyrs, Sir Imam Hussein (Peace Be Upon Him) Was Celebrated with Respect and Veneration throughout Iran
LDC_Translation_2: The 10th Day: The 10th Day and the Great Sacrifice of the Greatest of Martyrs, the Respected Imam Hussein (A) was Commemorated all over Iran with Reverence and Veneration Today.
LDC_Translation_3: Youm-e-Ashur--Ashura was celebrated today with respect and honor across Iran in commemoration of the Chief of Martyrs, Hadhrat Imam Hussein's supreme sacrifice.
LDC_Translation_4: Ashura Day: Ashura Day was observed across Iran today in commemoration of the great sacrifices rendered by Imam Hussein.

LDC_Translation_1: According to a report by Mehr News Agency, in all cities both large and small, including Iran's capital Tehran, the mourning of the Chief of Martyrs, Sir Imam Hussein (peace be upon him), was celebrated with great devotion and veneration. On this occasion, believers participated in memorial services and processions in great numbers and gave condolences to the Honorable Prophet (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) for the martyrdom of his family member (peace be upon him). Today all of Iran is mourning in remembrance of the great sacrifice of the grandson of the Honorable Prophet (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) Sir Imam Hussein (peace be upon him) in the field of Karbala. Believers relived the unparalleled sacrifice of the Chief of Martyrs, Sir Imam Hussein (peace be upon him) in Karbala and participated in memorial services and processions in great numbers.
LDC_Translation_2: According to the report of the news agency Mehr, in all small and big cities of Iran, including the capital Tehran, the mourning of the Greatest of the Martyrs, the respected Imam Hussein (A) was observed with great reverence and veneration. At this occasion, the believers attended the mourning meetings and the processions in large numbers and submitted their condolences to the Revered Prophet (P) with reference to the martyrdom of his household members (A). Today all of Iran is mournful and grief-stricken in the remembrance of the magnificent sacrifice of the respected Imam Hussein (A), the son of the Revered Prophet (P), in the plains of Karbala. The believers refreshed the memory of the unparalleled sacrifice of the Greatest of the Martyrs, the respected Imam Hussein (A) in the plains of Karbala and attended the mourning meetings and processions on a large scale.
LDC_Translation_3: According to the report of Mehr News Agency, martyrdom anniversary of the Chief of Martyrs, Hadhrat Imam Hussein, was celebrated with full honor and dignity in all small and big cities including Tehran, the capital of Iran. On this occasion, the faithful participated in the mourning processions in large numbers and mourned the martyrdom of Prophet Muhammad's son Imam Hussein in the battlefield of Karbala. The entire Iran was aggrieved and in mourning today in the memory of the supreme sacrifice of the Chief of Martyrs, Hadhrat Imam Hussein in the field of Karbala. The faithful participated in the condolence meetings and mourning processions, in large numbers.
LDC_Translation_4: According to the news agency Mehr, mourning processions were held in all the towns and cities of Iran, including its capital, Teheran. On this occasion, a large number of worshipers participated in mourning processions and read elegies on the martyrdom of Imam Hussein, the grandson of the prophet Mohammed. Today, all of Iran is in mourning over the great sacrifice rendered by Imam Hussein in Karbala. The worshippers honored the unprecedented sacrifices of Imam Hussein at the Karbala battlefield and took part in mourning processions and functions in large numbers.

LDC_Translation_1: On Sariab Road, an important highway in Quetta, firing by unidentified assailants claimed the lives of one DSP (Deputy Superintendent of Police) and four police officers.

LDC_Translation_1: On Wednesday morning two DSPs, one Sub-inspector, and two Constables were riding in a jeep towards the Police Training Center when unidentified assailants on a motorcycle near Degree College on Sariab Road started firing without provocation on the jeep, as a result of which Sub-inspector Mehdi and Constables Sabghat Ullah and Nasar Ullah were killed on the spot while DSP Hassan Ali died after reaching the hospital.
LDC_Translation_2: On Wednesday morning, two DSP, one sub-inspector, and two constables were going towards the police training center in a jeep when near Degree College on Saryab Road, two unknown attackers on motorcycle opened unprovoked fire on the police jeep, due to which sub-inspector Mehdi and Constables Sibghatullah and Nasrullah died on the spot while one DSP, Hasan Ali, died after reaching the hospital.
LDC_Translation_3: On Wednesday morning two DSPs, one Sub-Inspector and two constables were going towards the Police Training Centre in a jeep. Near Degree College at Siryab Road, assailants on a motorcycle began unprovoked firing at the police jeep killing the Sub-Inspector Mehdi and constables Sibghatullah and Nasrullah on the spot while DSP Hasan Ali later died of injuries in the hospital.
LDC_Translation_4: On Wednesday morning, two DSPs, a sub-inspector and two police constables were heading to the Police Training Center in a jeep, when unknown assailants on a motorbike opened fire indiscriminately on the police jeep near Degree College on Saryab Road. Sub-Inspector Mehdi, constables Sibghatullah and Nasrullah died on the scene, while DSP Hassan Ali succumbed to his injuries at the hospital.

LDC_Translation_1: I watched the Mumbai attack operations as if my own house was on fire. It is not easy to watch human suffering and this suffering is not visible to anyone? I wish Muslims could unite, and then think.

LDC_Translation_4: In reaction to the Mumbai attacks, India has been trying to reap the unusual diplomatic and military benefits. While projecting itself as a victim, it has acted wisely in exploiting these attacks. That's why the global pressure on Pakistan has now decreased despite strong global reaction initially.

LDC_Translation_1: Ignoring the needless fuss created by India, the United Nations expression of satisfaction over Pakistan's efforts and Interpol's President's commendation of Pakistani efforts are the fallout of India's diplomatic efforts, rather than its need.
LDC_Translation_2: The United Nations paying no heed to needless Indian cries and expressing satisfaction over Pakistan's efforts, and the Head of Interpol praising Pakistan's efforts, are the 'side effects' of India's unnecessary diplomatic efforts.
LDC_Translation_3: Without taking note of India's unnecessary hullabaloo, the expression of satisfaction over Pakistan's efforts by the United Nations and the appreciation by the Interpol's head of Pakistani efforts is the 'side-effect' of India's over enthusiastic diplomacy.
LDC_Translation_4: Without taking the note of the unnecessary Indian hype, the United Nations has expressed its satisfaction over the Pakistani efforts. The Interpol chief has also praised these efforts. Such international praise is the 'side effect' of India's unnecessary diplomacy.

LDC_Translation_1: There is no disagreement that this act is an extremely corrupt act.
LDC_Translation_2: There are no two opinions that this is a severe brutal act.
LDC_Translation_3: There are no divided opinions on the fact that this is a very cruel act.
LDC_Translation_4: Indisputably, this is a very inhumane act.

LDC_Translation_1: But the question is, when thousands of Taliban attacked the village of Peer Samiullah, where was the Pakistani army, and what was it doing?
LDC_Translation_2: But the question is that when thousands of Taliban attacked the village of Pir Samiullah where was the Pakistan army at that time and what it was doing?
LDC_Translation_3: But the question is that when thousands of Taliban attacked the village of Pir Samiullah, where was the Pakistan army and what was it doing?
LDC_Translation_4: The question is, where was the Pakistani army and what was it doing when thousands of Taliban attacked Peer Samiullah's village?

LDC_Translation_1: Should the army not be held accountable for whatever it did out there in a whole year?
LDC_Translation_2: Should the army not be held accountable for what they did during the one-year stay over there?
LDC_Translation_3: Should the army not be held accountable for what it has done there in one year?
LDC_Translation_4: Shouldn't the army be held accountable for what they did during the one-year period they spent there?

LDC_Translation_1: How many Taliban are being killed by the thousands of mortars and bombs that they drop everyday?
LDC_Translation_2: How may Taliban are killed with thousands of mortar and gun shells that the army sprays each day?
LDC_Translation_3: How many Taliban are killed by thousands of mortar and heavy artillery shells they fire every day?
LDC_Translation_4: How many Taliban are killed with the mortars and tank artillery they fire by the thousands on a daily basis?

LDC_Translation_1: I appeal to ISI that they should stop patronizing the Taliban and let us live in peace in the heavenly Swat,
LDC_Translation_2: I appeal the ISI please for God's sake leave patronizing Taliban and let us live in peace in the beautiful valley of Sawat
LDC_Translation_3: I appeal to the ISI that they, for God's sake, stop patronizing the Taliban and let us live in our Heavenly Swat in peace.
LDC_Translation_4: I appeal to the ISI to please stop sponsoring the Taliban; let us live peacefully in heavenly Swat.

LDC_Translation_1: and put an end to this fake operation.
LDC_Translation_2: and close up this bogus operation.
LDC_Translation_3: And stop this fake operation.
LDC_Translation_4: And stop this fake operation.

LDC_Translation_1: The day is not far away when a United Nations resolution relating to armed intervention in Pakistan will pass just like the way one was passed against Jamat-ud-Daawa.
LDC_Translation_2: That day is not far when a UN resolution for armed intervention in Pakistan will be passed in a similar way as has been in the case of Jamaat Al-Dawa.
LDC_Translation_3: The day is not far now when a resolution about military intervention in Pakistan will be passed in the United Nations in the same manner as it was passed against Jama'at-ud-Dawah.
LDC_Translation_4: One day the United Nations will pass a resolution regarding military intervention in Pakistan, the same as it has done against Jamat-u-Al Dawah.

LDC_Translation_1: Riaz Ahmed Faruqi.

LDC_Translation_4: Riyaz Ahmed Farooqui

LDC_Translation_1: To begin with, our extremists and their supporters themselves are constantly providing proofs and reasons for action against themselves, and whenever such a resolution is passed, there is a great possibility that no one will raise their voice at the United Nations in support of us.
LDC_Translation_2: First of all, our extremists and their supporters are themselves continuously providing all proofs and justifications for action against them, and it is clear that whenever such a resolution is presented in the United Nations, no voice will be raised in our favor,
LDC_Translation_3: Our extremists and their supporters are continuously providing all the proofs and justifications for action against them and, may I have soil in my mouth for saying such a cursed thing, the day such a resolution is tabled, there is every likelihood that no one will support us in the United Nations,
LDC_Translation_4: First of all, our extremists and their supporters themselves are providing all the evidence and justification for actions against them. It is quite possible that once such a resolution is proposed, not a single voice in the UN will be on our side.

LDC_Translation_1: And even if there is some delay in the passing of the resolution, one country or another will follow the example of America and attack us on their own.
LDC_Translation_2: and if the passing of such a resolution gets delayed, then any of the powers following the example of America will run over us on the basis of self-help.
LDC_Translation_3: and suppose there is some delay in the passage of such a resolution, some powerful country, following the precedent set by America, will launch an attack by itself.
LDC_Translation_4: Supposedly, if the adoption of such a resolution is delayed, some power like the USA will unilaterally attack it.

LDC_Translation_1: We do not have much familiarity with the personality and achievements of Peer Samiullah and we do not have information about what his activities were.
LDC_Translation_2: We are not aware and have no information about the personality and achievements of Pir Samiullah.
LDC_Translation_3: We have no knowledge of the personality and the achievements of Pir Samiuallah and of his activities.
LDC_Translation_4: I don't know what Peer Samiullah was like as a person, nor do I know about his achievements.

LDC_Translation_1: Probably he was not a revolutionary.
LDC_Translation_2: Perhaps he was not a revolutionary.
LDC_Translation_3: Perhaps he was not a revolutionary.
LDC_Translation_4: Perhaps he was not a revolutionary.

LDC_Translation_1: The way Comrade Che Guevara, Nawab Akbar Khan Bugti, Dr. Najibullah, and the bodies of thousands of dead revolutionaries have been desecrated at the hands of the enemies.
LDC_Translation_2: The matter in which the dead bodies of Comrade Che Guevara, Nawab Akbar Bugti, Doctor Najeebullah and several thousand other revolutionart were insulted by enemies.
LDC_Translation_3: Just as the dead bodies of comrade Che Guevara, Nawab Akbar Khan Bugti, Dr. Najeeb Ullah and thousands of other revolutionaries have been defiled by the enemies.
LDC_Translation_4: Even though the dead bodies of comrade Che Goera, Nawab Akbar Khan Bugti, Dr. Najeebullah and thousands of revolutionaries were handled with disrespect by their enemies,

LDC_Translation_1: They are immortal even after death.
LDC_Translation_2: They are alive even after death.
LDC_Translation_3: They are immortal even after their death.
LDC_Translation_4: they are immortal even after their death.

LDC_Translation_1: But here, an international game is being played. Here, people are being ruled by fear, inculcated through barbarism and bestiality.
LDC_Translation_2: But here an international game is being played and, the people are being ruled by making them afraid of terror and brutality.
LDC_Translation_3: But an international game is being played here. The people are being ruled by terrifying them through barbarity and brutality.
LDC_Translation_4: But the case here is different. An international game is being played here. People are being terrorized so that they can be controlled.

LDC_Translation_1: This is to justify their rule; that is, if they do not rule then such barbarians and beasts will rule.
LDC_Translation_2: A justification is being created that if we are not here, then the terrorists and fanatics will take over the reign of government.
LDC_Translation_3: So that a justification may be created that if we are not here, these beasts and brutes will take over the government.
LDC_Translation_4: And in order to justify remaining in power.

LDC_Translation_1: This act, which has been performed by Islamists in the name of religion, is highly condemnable.
LDC_Translation_2: This act of these so-called Islam lovers in the name of religion is highly deplorable.
LDC_Translation_3: This act of the so-called Islamists in the name of Islam is extremely condemnable act.
LDC_Translation_4: This action by Islamists in the name of religion is deplorable.

LDC_Translation_1: The supporters of these extremists can see the tyranny of America, but instead of feeling sorry about such acts, they excuse them by labeling them as tribal customs.
LDC_Translation_2: The supporters of these extremists can see the aggressions of America, but instead of cutting a sorry figure on brutal actions like this one, they give it the name of a tribal culture and in this way change track.
LDC_Translation_3: The supporters of these extremists can see the American atrocities but rather than expressing grief over such cruel acts, they evade the responsibility in the name of tribal customs.
LDC_Translation_4: The supporters of these extremists see the injustices perpetrated by the US. However, they ignore their own inhumane actions without expressing any remorse. Instead, they merely describe them as tribal traditions.

LDC_Translation_1: No sensitive person can cover such a brutal act in the name of tribal customs, or in the name of religion.
LDC_Translation_2: A person with a good heart cannot provide justifications for this type of brutal act, neither under the umbrella of tribal culture nor in the name of Islam.
LDC_Translation_3: No kind-hearted person has any justification for such a cruel act disguised in the tribal customs or perpetrated in the name of Islam.
LDC_Translation_4: A man of reason cannot justify such inhumane actions, which are sometimes carried out in the guise of tribal traditions and at other times carried out in the name of Islam.

LDC_Translation_1: I think people from our armed forces are in cahoots with them.
LDC_Translation_2: In my opinion, our army is supporting these people.
LDC_Translation_3: In my opinion, the personnel of our army are collaborating with them.
LDC_Translation_4: I think my army has an understanding with them.

LDC_Translation_1: When these people move from one place to another, it takes some time, during which they can be captured. But the army leaves the place, even if it's there, let alone capturing them during their movement.
LDC_Translation_2: It is because when these people move, it surely takes time. There is enough time to arrest them, but they run away - even if they are present at the occasion, let alone reaching the spot.
LDC_Translation_3: This is proven by the fact that when these people move, the movement would at least take so much time that that they could be arrested. But let alone reaching the spot, these people even if they are in vicinity, flee the place.
LDC_Translation_4: Because it is understandable that it may take time for the army to move there and nab them. But, how can they manage to flee even if the army is present there.

LDC_Translation_1: Are those people so fearless that they keep 50 to 70 people as hostages and our army watches the show?
LDC_Translation_2: Are they so brave that they hold fifty, seventy people as hostages, and our army watches them as a spectator doing nothing.
LDC_Translation_3: Are these guys so powerful that they can take fifty to seventy men hostage and our army keeps watching the spectacle idly?
LDC_Translation_4: Are they brave enough to kidnap 50-70 people? The army merely keeps watching as a spectator.

LDC_Translation_1: They are creatures of Allah, and so is our army.
LDC_Translation_2: Both the army and these people are Allah's creation.
LDC_Translation_3: They are humans as is the army.
LDC_Translation_4: Both kidnappers and army men are human beings.

LDC_Translation_1: It's clear that there is something fishy going on.
LDC_Translation_2: It is evident that something is black at the bottom.
LDC_Translation_3: It is evident that there is something fishy.
LDC_Translation_4: It is quite clear that there is something else going on behind the scenes.

LDC_Translation_1: The great dictator of his time, Zia-ul-Haq, due to his authoritarianism, instead of highlighting the compassionate and merciful attributes of God, created an atmosphere of fear and terror for the faith through the discussions of the variety of forms of God's wrath and punishments. The incidence of the hanging corpse and books titled "What Will Happen After Death" produce fear and terror.
LDC_Translation_2: The religious scholars since the truly dictatorial regime of dictator of the world Zia-ul-Haq, contrary to projecting God's attributes of kindness and affection, have been creating an atmosphere of fear and terror by telling countless stories of punishments and admonitions in the name of religion, in which the incident of hanging dead bodies and additionally their literature and books like 'What will happen after death' are also creating fear and terror.
LDC_Translation_3: Since the era of true dictatorship of Zia-ul-Haq, the Mullahism has been creating such an atmosphere of fear and terror in the name of religion by its descriptions of the various kinds of exemplary punishments and torture rather than highlighting the mercy and love of God. Besides, the incident of hanging of the corpse, their literature and books like 'What will Happen after the Death' strike terror in the hearts.
LDC_Translation_4: Since the time of the dictator Ziaul Haq, who was the real dictator, Mullahism has been reminding us about different types of punishments and telling wise stories in the name of religion, creating an atmosphere of terror. Instead they should have highlighted qualities of God such as mercy. Incidents like hanging dead bodies (on trees) and their literature, like the book titled "What will happen after death?," also create a sense of terror and fear.

LDC_Translation_1: And these people are using fear and terror as the tools for obtaining worldly profits, gains, and grandeur.
LDC_Translation_2: And with a purpose to gain worldly prestige, these people are using fear and terror as a tool.
LDC_Translation_3: And these people are using this fear and terror as a weapon merely to get the wealth and status of this world.
LDC_Translation_4: These people have been exploiting terror as a means of achieving status for themselves in this world.

LDC_Translation_1: Waazu!
LDC_Translation_2: 'O' religious speakers!
LDC_Translation_3: 'O Preachers
LDC_Translation_4: Mullahs!

LDC_Translation_1: You are the one who planted the fear of hell fire among all.
LDC_Translation_2: You frightened the world so much from the hell fire
LDC_Translation_3: You have so terrorized the world by the fires of hell
LDC_Translation_4: You have cautioned others about hell fire.

LDC_Translation_1: You became the face of fear itself.
LDC_Translation_2: That your face turned into the face of fear'
LDC_Translation_3: That you have become fear incarnate'
LDC_Translation_4: However, you yourselves have become an image of terror.

LDC_Translation_1: It's amazing when it is said that this cannot be the work of a Muslim.
LDC_Translation_2: It surprises us when it is said that this cannot be the activity of a Muslim.
LDC_Translation_3: It surprises me when it is said that this cannot be a Muslim's deed.
LDC_Translation_4: I feel strange when it is said that this is not the work of a Muslim person.

LDC_Translation_1: We are ignorant of our own history, or we intentionally do not want to face it?
LDC_Translation_2: We are ignorant of our own history or intentionally avoid it.
LDC_Translation_3: We are either ignorant of our history or overlook it for the sake of convenience.
LDC_Translation_4: We don't know about our own history, or we hide the fact intentionally.

LDC_Translation_1: After the demise of the Prophet, due to the refusal to take the oath of allegiance, the door to his daughter's house was set fire, and who put a noose around her husband's neck, and dragged him around?
LDC_Translation_2: As a result of a refusal to offer allegiance after the death of the Prophet, who burned down the closed door of the daughter of God's Messenger and, who dragged her husband after putting a rope around his neck?
LDC_Translation_3: Who burnt the door of the house of the Prophet's daughter when she refused to the oath of allegiance and who dragged her husband by tying a rope in his neck?
LDC_Translation_4: Who set fire to the door of the Prophet's daughter after his death? And, who dragged her husband with rope around his neck?

LDC_Translation_1: Were they outsiders?
LDC_Translation_2: Did they come from somewhere outside?
LDC_Translation_3: Had they come from somewhere outside?
LDC_Translation_4: Were they outsiders?

LDC_Translation_4: Were the attacks on Medina by Yazeed's army and the incident in Karbala carried out by Indians and Jews?

LDC_Translation_1: Without accepting the truth, the motives have neither been understood, nor have they been addressed.
LDC_Translation_2: Without accepting facts, neither motives can be eliminated nor remedies made.
LDC_Translation_3: Without accepting the facts, we can neither quash the motives nor can we provide redress.
LDC_Translation_4: Without admitting the facts, motives have never been addressed.

LDC_Translation_1: BBC, end your two-faced policy!
LDC_Translation_2: Those running BBC should stop dual policy.
LDC_Translation_3: O BBC people, stop this dual policy.
LDC_Translation_4: BBC! Stop pursuing your policy of using a double standard.

LDC_Translation_2: More super hit topic than this: 'Was throwing shoes on Bush right or wrong?'

LDC_Translation_1: Friend, show some shame. A man was dug out of a grave and hanged on a pole because he raised his voice against injustice, and all you can think of is the topic of the box office.
LDC_Translation_2: My friend, feel a little bit of shame a person was taken out from the grave and hanged with a pole merely because he raised his voice against aggression, and you are interested more in box office topic.
LDC_Translation_3: Friend, feel some shame. A man's body was exhumed and suspended to the pole only because he had raised his voice against cruelty. And you are worried about titles for box office?
LDC_Translation_4: My dear, for shame. You are talking about Box Office, while the dead body of a person was taken out of his grave and hung on a pole because he had raised his voice against injustice.

LDC_Translation_1: For Operation Lionheart's success, and its success on the other side of the border depends on which side the common people are inclined to support.

LDC_Translation_1: This is the work of American and Pakistani agencies and friend Peer has been a victim of their scheme.
LDC_Translation_2: This is the work of American and Pakistani intelligence agencies and Pir Sahib has fallen prey to this conspiracy.
LDC_Translation_3: This act has been perpetrated by the Pakistani and American agencies and Pir sahib has fallen prey to this conspiracy.
LDC_Translation_4: This initiative has been undertaken by American and Pakistani agencies. Peer Saheb has fallen prey to this conspiracy.

LDC_Translation_1: All the comments made in this forum now will be against the Taliban, because secret agents have successfully infiltrated the ranks of the Taliban and are taking steps to change public opinion.
LDC_Translation_2: On this forum, now all commentaries will be anti-Taliban, because intelligence agencies' persons have successfully entered in the Taliban ranks, and they are taking such measures that can alter general public opinion.
LDC_Translation_3: From now on, all the comments on this forum will be anti-Taliban because the agents of the secret services have successfully penetrated Taliban and are conducting such actions as can change the common man's opinion.
LDC_Translation_4: All comments in this forum will now focus on opposing the Taliban, because intelligence people have now joined the Taliban and are taking steps that may change public opinion.

LDC_Translation_1: What I would like to ask is that while this dead body was hanging there for a whole day, what were the soldiers doing there? Do they only sit there to target civilians? And then the way they issue a statement like this - "Taliban hideouts attacked, a mother and her three kids killed when the house was bombed."
LDC_Translation_2: I would just like to ask that, when, for a full one day this dead body remained hanging, then what the army people were doing there; are they sitting there only to target the general population. They give statements like this: 'Bombing on Taliban hideouts, shelling on house kills 2 children and their mother'.
LDC_Translation_3: I would just like to ask what was the army doing when this dead body kept hanging from the pole for the whole day? Are they sitting there just to target the common people? Their statements are like, 'shelling on the hideouts of the Taliban, 2 children and their mother killed by a shell hitting the home'.
LDC_Translation_4: The dead body kept hanging for a whole day. I have just one question to ask. Where was the army? What were the soldiers doing? Is their only job to target the common man? Their statements read as: 'Taliban positions bombed, 2 children, their mother killed'.

LDC_Translation_1: Did they not know about this square?
LDC_Translation_2: Were they not aware of this crossing?
LDC_Translation_3: Did they not know about this square?
LDC_Translation_4: Didn't they know about that place?

LDC_Translation_1: Or were they watching the show?
LDC_Translation_2: Or they were watching a game?
LDC_Translation_3: Or, were they watching the spectacle?
LDC_Translation_4: Or they were merely watching like spectators?

LDC_Translation_1: We plead and beg for God's sake, put an end to this game.
LDC_Translation_2: We request you to please close this game for the sake of God.
LDC_Translation_3: We humbly request and plead that for God's sake, stop this game.
LDC_Translation_4: We request humbly and with folded hands that this game be stopped, for God's sake.

LDC_Translation_1: Lest you forget there is also someone who is watching over you.
LDC_Translation_2: After all, there is a Ruler above you, as well.
LDC_Translation_3: After all, there is one Ruler above you too.
LDC_Translation_4: There is a ruler (God) above you!

LDC_Translation_1: A question was put forth by BBC whether appropriate or not, but the superficiality of it was disheartening. For instance, no one asked the question as to what the 30,000 armed troops in Swat have gone there to accomplish.
LDC_Translation_2: Even if the question asked by the BBC is rational or irrational, we feel sorry to observe the superficial knowledge of writers, for example no one asked the question that, what was the objective before thirty thousand soldiers went to Sawat?
LDC_Translation_3: Whether or not the question asked by BBC was appropriate, the credulity of the writers hurts. For instance, no one asked why had this thirty thousand strong army gone to Swat?
LDC_Translation_4: It does not matter whether the question asked by the BBC is reasonable or not. However, the low standard of the comments is regrettable. For example, nobody asked what 30,000 army men were doing in Swat...

LDC_Translation_1: The corpses of those who fight the Taliban and support the army dangle all day long from the poles.
LDC_Translation_2: Those who help the army and fight the Taliban, their dead bodies keep hanging with street poles the whole day.
LDC_Translation_3: That the corpses of those who support the army and fight Taliban remain hanging from poles all day long.
LDC_Translation_4: while the dead bodies of those helping the army and fighting the Taliban were hanging on poles,

LDC_Translation_1: Whatever was done to the people of Swat by the cursed Pakistani army they did. But the media, including the BBC, did not do any good by hiding the truth from the world.
LDC_Translation_2: Whatever treatment the people of Sawat received from the army was not respectable, but the media, including the BBC, has done no good by keeping the real fact away from the world.
LDC_Translation_3: Even if we overlook what the ill-omened Pakistan army did to the Swati people, the media including BBC has done no good by hiding the facts from the world.
LDC_Translation_4: let alone what the Pakistani army did to the people of Swat. However, even the media, including the BBC, kept the world in the dark with regard to the real facts. In doing so, they did not do the right thing.

LDC_Translation_1: The Pakistani army is staging a play.
LDC_Translation_2: The Pakistan army is playing a game.
LDC_Translation_3: Pakistan army is play-acting.
LDC_Translation_4: The Pakistani army is staging a drama.

LDC_Translation_1: Every child of Swat is saying that this is a bloody drama.
LDC_Translation_2: Everyone in Sawat says that this is a bloody drama.
LDC_Translation_3: Every child of Swat is saying that this is a gory play.
LDC_Translation_4: Every child in Swat would say that it is a bloody one.

LDC_Translation_1: For God's sake, end the drama.
LDC_Translation_2: Please stop it, for God's sake.
LDC_Translation_3: For God's sake, stop this drama.
LDC_Translation_4: Stop this drama, for God's sake!

LDC_Translation_1: These Taliban have given Muslims a bad name.
LDC_Translation_2: These Taliban have tarnished Muslims' name.
LDC_Translation_3: These Taliban have tarnished the reputation of the Muslims.
LDC_Translation_4: The Taliban have destroyed the image of Muslims.

LDC_Translation_1: If true Muslims in the whole world do not consider them Muslims, then why do these terrorists find refuge in their own area?
LDC_Translation_2: If in the whole world, true Muslims do not consider them Muslim then why they allow terrorists to live in their areas.
LDC_Translation_3: If all the true Muslims of the world don't call them as Muslims, how can then these terrorist find safe havens in their lands?
LDC_Translation_4: If Muslims all over the world had not accepted them as Muslims, they would not have found a foothold anywhere.

LDC_Translation_1: Those who have become shameless, who do not want to work hard, get guns and join their groups.
LDC_Translation_2: Those who are unconcerned about their self respect and cannot do hard work, they take a gun and join their group.
LDC_Translation_3: Those who lack all sense of honor and can't work hard take up the gun and join these groups.
LDC_Translation_4: Those who have no shame and can't work to earn a living take to guns and join their group.

LDC_Translation_1: Islam did not come about by force using a gun or a sword.
LDC_Translation_2: Islam did not come through the force of gun or sword.
LDC_Translation_3: Islam has not flourished because of gun or sword.
LDC_Translation_4: Islam was not spread with the gun or the sword.

LDC_Translation_1: You should be ashamed.
LDC_Translation_2: Feel ashamed.
LDC_Translation_3: Shame, shame.
LDC_Translation_4: For shame.

LDC_Translation_1: The answer to this cannot be found in any religion or any family tradition.
LDC_Translation_2: It has no justification, neither in any religion nor in any family tradition.
LDC_Translation_3: Neither any religion nor any family traditions provides its justification.
LDC_Translation_4: Neither any religion nor any family tradition allows for it.

LDC_Translation_1: The whole media, including the BBC, is speculating about the Taliban and the tribes using different sources.
LDC_Translation_2: The whole media, including BBC broadcasts commentaries on the subject of the Taliban and tribes through different sources
LDC_Translation_3: All the media including BBC comment through various sources on Taliban and the tribes.
LDC_Translation_4: All media outlets, including the BBC, comment about the Taliban and tribes.

LDC_Translation_1: But nobody knows what the actual situation is. We know, because we ourselves are tribesmen.
LDC_Translation_2: but no one knows what is the real situation, we are the only people who have knowledge of this because we are tribal.
LDC_Translation_3: But no one knows what the actual position is. We know it because we are the tribal people.
LDC_Translation_4: But, none of them is aware of the real situation. Only we know what the real situation is, because we are tribal people.

LDC_Translation_1: In short, this is a game in which the CIA, RAW, Mosad, and our own ISI are involved. There are no Taliban or tribesmen; there are terrorist who have been created to give a bad name to Islam, Taliban, Madrasahs, Pashtun people, tribes and the tribal customs.

LDC_Translation_1: And my question to you is do the teachings of Islam, or those of the East or West give any logic, philosophy, or reasoning that approves of the killing of innocent citizens, including people who are praying, laborers, and low-income workers, and employees, as a consequence of American attacks?
LDC_Translation_2: And my question is, does all wisdom ranging from Islamic to Eastern and Western, any logic, rational and philosophy gives permission to kill innocent public, including those who pray, laborers and poor employees, only to get the revenge of American strikes.
LDC_Translation_3: And my question to you is that do any system of knowledge ranging from Islamic to eastern and western, any logic, argument or philosophy sanction the murders of innocent prayer-goers, laborers, and poor working class servants in response to the American attacks?
LDC_Translation_4: And my question to you is, right from Islamic teachings to that of western and eastern religions, no logic, argument or philosophy can justify the killings of innocent people, including Namazis, laborers and poor workers, by American assault.

LDC_Translation_1: And if there is no answer, then you have a dire need to correct your point of view.
LDC_Translation_2: If the answer is no, then there is a strong need to get your point of view rectified.
LDC_Translation_3: And if the answer is in negative, you are in dire need of amending your point of view.
LDC_Translation_4: And if your answer is negative, then you should check on your point of view- you are required to reform.

LDC_Translation_1: At the time when people were given arms, it was feared that Russia, after Afghanistan, would turn its attention to Pakistan; therefore people were provided the arms.
LDC_Translation_2: The people were given arms because of the concern that Russia after Afghanistan would move towards Pakistan and, therefore, these people were given arms.
LDC_Translation_3: People were armed. At the time there was the threat that after conquering Afghanistan, Russia would target Pakistan. Therefore, these people were armed.
LDC_Translation_4: People were armed. At that point in time, it was believed that Russia could move into Pakistan after Afghanistan; therefore, people were armed.

LDC_Translation_1: Now that we suspect America to attack Pakistan from Afghanistan, which the present American president has spoken about during his presidential campaign, why then should we disarm these people?
LDC_Translation_2: Now, when there is a concern that America will attack Pakistan through Afghanistan - and this has been openly indicated by the existing American President in his presidential election campaign - then why should we disarm these people?
LDC_Translation_3: Now when there is the danger that America would attack Pakistan via Afghanistan, the current American President has expressed this openly during his presidential campaign, so why should we disarm these people?
LDC_Translation_4: Now when there is a serious concern that America could attack Pakistan through Afghanistan, which was time and again expressed by the currentAmerican president during his election campaign, why should we disarm them?

LDC_Translation_1: So that America or India, after subduing the Pakistani armed forces, do not have to face any kind of resistance from the people?
LDC_Translation_2: Only for the reason that after overpowering the Pakistan army, America or India do not have to face public resistance of any type.
LDC_Translation_3: Only to ensure that after conquering the Pakistan army, America or India would not have to face any public resistance?
LDC_Translation_4: Only because America should not face a backlash from them after defeating India and Pakistan?

LDC_Translation_1: However if anyone is involved in oppressive activities, Pakistan should take an action against them only.
LDC_Translation_2: Yes, if any one among them is found involved in terrorist activities, only Pakistan should take action against him.
LDC_Translation_3: True, if anyone of them is found involved in a terrorist activity, only Pakistan should take action against him.
LDC_Translation_4: But if someone is involved in destructive activities, Pakistan should deal with them in a tough manner.

LDC_Translation_1: Regretfully, the government's seizing of Lashkar-e-Tayaba has proven India right about Pakistan being involved in this affair.
LDC_Translation_2: But sorry to say that the government's action against Lashkar-e-Taiba made the Indian point of view correct that Pakistan is involved in this.
LDC_Translation_3: But the sad aspect of it is that government's action against Lashkar-e-Taiba has verified Indian claims that Pakistan is involved in it.
LDC_Translation_4: By being on Lashkar-e-Taiba's side, the government of Pakistan had proved India right that Pakistan is involved in this. This is very disappointing.

LDC_Translation_1: *Najeeb-ur-Rehman Saiko*, Lahore, Pakistan.
LDC_Translation_2: Najeeb-ur-Rehman Sieko, Lahore [P@KI$T@N]
LDC_Translation_3: Najeeb-ur-Rehman Psycho, *Lahore [P@KI$T@N] *
LDC_Translation_4: Najeeburrehman Saiko, Lahore, Pakistan.

LDC_Translation_1: Even if it is accepted that Lashkar-e-Tayaba is involved, it is not right to blame Pakistan's Government.
LDC_Translation_2: If it is accepted that Lashkar-e-Taiba in involved, then implicating the Pakistan government is also incorrect.
LDC_Translation_3: Even if it is accepted that Lashkar-e-Taiba is involved, blaming Pakistan government is not right.
LDC_Translation_4: Even if we accept that Lashkar-e-Taiba was involved, it is not right to blame the Pakistan government for that.

LDC_Translation_1: And another question is did these terrorists not have the support of some government or non-government officer in India?
LDC_Translation_2: Another question is whether these terrorists were supported by any governmental or non-governmental employee of India?
LDC_Translation_3: And this question too: did these terrorists not have the support of some official or unofficial Indian agent?
LDC_Translation_4: And there is also a question whether these terrorists were not supported by some government or non-government recruits of India or not.

LDC_Translation_1: Are terrorists born or trained only in Pakistan and not in India, or any other countries of the world?
LDC_Translation_2: And whether terrorists are only born or created in Pakistan and not created in India and other countries of the world?
LDC_Translation_3: Are the terrorists produced and trained only in Pakistan and are not trained in India and the other countries of the world?
LDC_Translation_4: Are terrorists only born in Pakistan and not in India and other parts of the world?

LDC_Translation_1: As far as Lashkar-e-Tayaba is concerned, it has got nothing to do with the recent acts of terrorism.
LDC_Translation_2: As far Lashkar-e-Taiba is concerned, recent terrorist activities have no linkages with them.
LDC_Translation_3: As far as Lashkar-e-Taiba is concerned, it has no link with the recent terrorism.
LDC_Translation_4: As far as Lashkar-e-Taiba is concerned, it has no connection in the recent terror attacks.

LDC_Translation_1: A point to remember is that it was Hafiz Saeed who was the first "Jihadi leader" to label the acts of the Taliban as "chaos."
LDC_Translation_2: The thing that must be kept in mind is that Hafiz Saeed was the first 'jihadi leader' who termed the activities of the Taliban a 'sedition'.
LDC_Translation_3: It is worth remembering that Hafiz Saeed was the first 'jihadist leader' who declared the Taliban activities as 'seditious'.
LDC_Translation_4: It is to be remembered that Hafiz Saeed was the first 'Jihadi Leader' who declared Taliban's activities as a 'Fitnah'.

LDC_Translation_1: I am completely sure that the Taliban's invasion is [a part of] American plans. Therefore, it is necessary to remove every person and group from the way who should challenge the Taliban in any way.
LDC_Translation_2: I have a strong belief that Taliban activities are an integral part of the American planning, and any person or group who challenges the Taliban on any pretext, it becomes essential for them to clear him from their way.
LDC_Translation_3: I firmly believe that the Taliban insurgence is a vital part of American strategy so every person or group who opposes Taliban in any way will have to be removed from the scene.
LDC_Translation_4: I firmly believe that the tumult of the Taliban is an essential element of American plans, and therefore it is necessary to remove all such people and organizations from the way who, in any capacity, can challenge the authority of the Taliban.

LDC_Translation_1: Despite the consensus of the whole nation, under pressure from India carrying out an action against Lashkar reflects the nervous and servile nature of Zardari and company.
LDC_Translation_2: Despite support from the whole nation, taking action against Lashkar under Indian pressure indicates Zardari and Company's anxiety and their sycophant nature.
LDC_Translation_3: Despite co-operation from all the nation, the action against Lashkar under Indian pressure is an indication of the nervousness and sycophantic disposition of Zardari & Co.
LDC_Translation_4: Even after support from the entire nation, Zardari and company's action, under India's pressure against Lashkar, indicates their panic and flattering nature.

LDC_Translation_1: To bring an end to this campaign, which was started by the Saudi and American funding, a request should be made of them, for God's sake, to clean up this mess, which has poisoned our society.
LDC_Translation_2: To bring this mission, launched with the American and Saudi funding, to an end, a request should be made to both of them saying that in the name of God please clean up this filth that has poisoned our society.
LDC_Translation_3: To end this movement that started with American and Saudi funding, now request them to mop up this corruption that has contaminated our society.
LDC_Translation_4: To finish this movement started by American-Saudi funding, we will only have to request them to clean this filth which has poisoned our society.

LDC_Translation_1: A protest should also be lodge with them as under what guise did America and Saudi Arabia spread the virus of dangerous weapons in our country and so-called Jihadis, and truly hateful literature and culture, which opened human slaughterhouses in our country?
LDC_Translation_2: Also record a protest with them saying that on what moral grounds the American and Saudis together spread dangerous arms and so-called jihadis, but in reality the virus of contemptuous literature and culture, as a result of which human slaughter houses were opened up in our country.
LDC_Translation_3: Also let us register protest with America and Saudi Arabia that on what moral grounds had they spread the virus of dangerous arms and so-called jihadist which are actually hate literature and culture prompting killings in our country.
LDC_Translation_4: We have to resist against them and ask as to under which moral ground America and Saudi Arabia had supplied dangerous weapons, so called Jihadis, literature, and a culture of hatred to our country which had opened human butchery in our country.

LDC_Translation_1: America was badly rattled when the Pakistani army declared, after fear of an Indian attack, that it would move its forces from the Afghan border and pay attention to India, and the Taliban announced that they would take care of the Afghan border. America used all means available to stop an Indian attack on Pakistan.
LDC_Translation_2: After the danger of Indian attack, the Pakistan army's announcement that they will withdraw their forces from the Afghan border to pay attention to India and, subsequently, the Taliban's announcement that they will take care of Afghan borders disturbed the Americans, who did their utmost to avoid an Indian attack on Pakistan.
LDC_Translation_3: After the threat of Indian attack and the declaration by the Pakistan army that they would move the troops from Afghan border and post them against India, and the declaration by the Taliban that they would take care of the Afghan border, America stumbled and used full force to ensure that India did not attack Pakistan.
LDC_Translation_4: After India threatened to attack, Pakistan declared its intention to remove its army from its Afghan border to tackle the current issue with India, and Taliban declared that they will look after the Afghan border. America was shattered, and left no one stone unturned to ensure that India should not attack Pakistan.

LDC_Translation_1: And this exposed America's reputation in this area.
LDC_Translation_2: This fully exposed the secret of American strength in this region.
LDC_Translation_3: This has revealed the truth about American power in the area.
LDC_Translation_4: This has harmed America's reputation in the region.

LDC_Translation_1: Although India neither threatened to attack, nor does it have the guts to do so,
LDC_Translation_2: Though India neither issued the threat for attack nor it has the courage to do this.
LDC_Translation_3: Although India has neither threatened to attack nor does she have courage.
LDC_Translation_4: Although India has not threatened to attack, nor does it have the courage to do it.

LDC_Translation_1: the rest has been taken care of by the Taliban's attacks on American supplies.
LDC_Translation_2: The rest of the task was fulfilled by the Taliban's attack on the American supply line.
LDC_Translation_3: And the rest was done by the Taliban attacks on American supplies.
LDC_Translation_4: Taliban's attack on American supplies proved fatal even for them.

LDC_Translation_1: It proves that without the support of the Pakistani army and the Pakistani Government, America is nothing.
LDC_Translation_2: It has been proven that without the support of the Pak Army and government, America is nothing.
LDC_Translation_3: Thus it is proven that without the support of Pakistan army and the government of Pakistan, America is nothing.
LDC_Translation_4: It is proved that, without the support of the Pakistan army and the government of Pakistan, America is nothing.

LDC_Translation_1: Karachi, Pakistan's trade and finance hub is like the Dubai of all undeveloped areas.
LDC_Translation_2: Karachi being Pakistan's financial and commercial hub is a Dubai for all under-developed areas.
LDC_Translation_3: Karachi, Pakistan's financial hub is Dubai of all the backward areas.
LDC_Translation_4: The financial business hub of Karachi, Pakistan, is the Dubai of all the backward regions.

LDC_Translation_1: Millions do not leave this place empty-handed. But ever since the western border areas have become lawless, Karachi has become the focus of everyone's attention.
LDC_Translation_2: Hundreds of thousands of people never return empty-handed from this city, but the absence of rules of law in western border areas, Karachi has invited the attention of all.
LDC_Translation_3: Millions never return empty-handed from here. But ever since the supremacy of law has been challenged in the western frontier areas, all the people have diverted their attention to Karachi.
LDC_Translation_4: Millions of people come here and no one leaves empty-handed, but after lawlessness prevailed in the border areas, Karachi has become the focal point for all.

LDC_Translation_1: Now they are on the verge of taking this city hostage.
LDC_Translation_2: Now they are bent upon the abduction of this city.
LDC_Translation_3: Now they are bent upon to take this city hostage.
LDC_Translation_4: Now they are bent on hijacking the city.

LDC_Translation_1: For the first time, Pathans are being referred to as Pakhtuns, and inhabitants of the same city are being considered outsiders to make them fight each other, although the need is for unity.
LDC_Translation_2: For the first time, Pathans are being regarded as Pukhtoons, due to which the residents of the same city are made to fight as strangers, whereas the need is for unity.
LDC_Translation_3: For the first time, the Pathans are being called Pakhtoons. People of the same city are being made to fight as strangers although there is need to show solidarity.
LDC_Translation_4: for the first time, Pathans are called Pakhtoons, and people of one city are lined up against the others, whereas harmony is the need of the hour.

LDC_Translation_1: One solution to the problem is that either the Urdu-speaking people should learn Pashto, or the Pashto-speaking people should learn Urdu, or everyone learns English, that would be even better.
LDC_Translation_2: One solution to the problem is that either those who speak Urdu should learn Pushto or those who speak Pushto should learn Urdu or much better if all learn English.
LDC_Translation_3: One solution to the problem is that all Urdu speaking people learn to speak Pushto, or vice versa. And if all the people learn to speak English, it would be even better.
LDC_Translation_4: One solution to the problem is that Urdu-speaking people should learn Pashtu and vice versa, or if all the people should learn English, all the better.

LDC_Translation_1: You would definitely find this suggestion amusing, but don't you find the reason of the clash amusing?
LDC_Translation_2: You will certainly treat it as a ridiculous proposal, but don't you feel the reason for conflict as being silly?
LDC_Translation_3: You would definitely consider it a ridiculous piece of advice but does the cause of the clash not seem ridiculous to you?
LDC_Translation_4: You will definitely see it as a ridiculous proposal, but don't you think the reason for violence is equally ridiculous?

LDC_Translation_1: That the reason for violence is language?
LDC_Translation_2: That language is the cause of violence?
LDC_Translation_3: That language may be the cause of violence?
LDC_Translation_4: Can language be the reason for violence?

LDC_Translation_1: Zaheer Chughtai.
LDC_Translation_2: Zaheer Chughtai
LDC_Translation_3: Zaheer Chughtai
LDC_Translation_4: Zaheer Chughtai

LDC_Translation_1: Actually, sir I gave this suggestion many times as a child to my friends who belonged to different religious and linguistic groups, but they used to laugh it off.
LDC_Translation_2: Sir, in my childhood, I presented this proposal many times to my friends consisting of people from all religious and linguistic groups, but they used to laugh at these proposals.
LDC_Translation_3: Sir, time and again I offered this piece of advice to my friends who belonged to all religious and linguistic groups, during my childhood but every time people used to laugh at it.
LDC_Translation_4: Sir, as a child, I made this suggestion many times to my friends who hailed from different religious and language groups, but they would always laugh at me.

LDC_Translation_1: In those days, these linguistic and religious differences were not as strong and active as they are now. They were just percolating beneath the surface.
LDC_Translation_2: At that time, these linguistics and religious hatred was not as powerful and strong as this is today but was internally gathering strength.
LDC_Translation_3: These linguistic and religious hatreds were at that time not as powerful and strong as they are today and were mellowing within the hearts.
LDC_Translation_4: At that point in time, language- and religion-based hatred was just growing. It was not as violent and strong as it is today.

LDC_Translation_1: It is hard to understand what is happening and why it is happening?
LDC_Translation_2: Do not understand what and why is happening?
LDC_Translation_3: I cannot understand what this is and why this is happening.
LDC_Translation_4: I don't understand what is happening and why.

LDC_Translation_1: Are these the signs of the Day of Judgment?
LDC_Translation_2: Are these signs of the day of judgment?
LDC_Translation_3: Are these the signs of the doomsday?
LDC_Translation_4: Is it an indication of insurrection?

LDC_Translation_1: For what reason are the innocent and blameless people being killed?
LDC_Translation_2: For what offense are the innocent and blameless being killed?
LDC_Translation_3: For what crime are the innocent people being killed?
LDC_Translation_4: Innocent people are being killed for things not their fault?

LDC_Translation_1: The reasons are obvious. Those who want to break up Pakistan are the ones who are emotional and they do not belong to any religion or country.
LDC_Translation_2: Reasons are in front of us all - the same people who want to turn Pakistan into pieces are active, and they don't have any country or religion.
LDC_Translation_3: The reasons are before every one. Those who want to disintegrate this country are active and those who do it have neither any religion nor any country.
LDC_Translation_4: The reasons are before everyone. Those who want to break Pakistan, only they are active. Whoever is doing all this has no religion, and belongs to no country.

LDC_Translation_1: Be it Karachi or Mumbai, the home has been set on fire by its own inhabitants.
LDC_Translation_2: Whether it is Karachi or Mumbai, both have been burned by their own people.
LDC_Translation_3: Whether it be Karachi or Mumbai, the destruction has been caused by inmates.
LDC_Translation_4: Whether it is Karachi or Mumbai, the house caught fire from its own lamp.

LDC_Translation_1: Whichever government comes in, it tries to make a name for itself simply by changing the names of places; like these days, airports, roads, buildings, everything is being named after Benazir.
LDC_Translation_2: Whichever government comes into power, they start earning their name by changing the names of places, for example, these days airport, road, building are all Benazir.
LDC_Translation_3: Whichever government comes, it only changes the names of places to become famous. For instance, now a days airports, roads and buildings are all called Benazir.
LDC_Translation_4: Whichever government comes along, it seems to be only interested in changing names for popularity. For example, airports, roads, buildings all are named after Benazeer.

LDC_Translation_1: Does the name Benazir represent whatever is happening to the people of Karachi and Pakistan?
LDC_Translation_2: Does the "treatment" being meted out to the people of Karachi and Pakistan be called "Benazir"?
LDC_Translation_3: Does Benazir mean that what has been happening to the people of Karachi and Pakistan?
LDC_Translation_4: Whatever is happening in Karachi and Pakistan, could it be called 'Be-nazeer'?

LDC_Translation_1: At the peak of the Mumbai attacks, the failure of RAW that instigated riots based on linguistic differences in Karachi is proof that the political elements that used to work on RAW's payroll in the past have resigned from their job.
LDC_Translation_2: When the Mumbai attacks were at their peak, the failure of an attempt to start linguistic disturbances in Karachi proves that those who were at the payroll of RAW in the past have now resigned.
LDC_Translation_3: The failure of RAW's attempt to ignite linguistic violence in Karachi at the height of the Mumbai attacks proves that the political elements that used to be on RAW's payroll have now resigned from the service.
LDC_Translation_4: While the Mumbai terror attack is on the ascendancy, a failed attempt by RAW to incite a language-based riot shows that the political elements working on behalf of RAW, are retired from the job.

LDC_Translation_1: The unwarranted killings of the Pashto-speaking laborers and India's threats have awakened Pakistani nationalism from Karachi to Khyber.
LDC_Translation_2: The sleeping Pakistanism has been awakened from Karachi to Khyber by the killings of innocent Pushtoon laborers and the Indian threats.
LDC_Translation_3: The murders of Pushto speaking laborers and the Indian threats have awakend the dormant nationalism in Pakistanis from Karachi to Khyber.
LDC_Translation_4: The blood of innocent Pashtu-speaking laborers and Indian threats awakened the sentiment of Pakistanism from Karachi to Khaibar.

LDC_Translation_1: While this strong display of patriotism from all the political, religious, linguistic, and national parties has taught a diplomatic lesson to India, it has also given the American policy makers another opportunity to think.
LDC_Translation_2: A strong, uniform patriotic reaction from all political, religious, linguistic and national parities has not only taught India the diplomatic norms, it has also provided Americans with another opportunity to think about.
LDC_Translation_3: The identical patriotic reaction by all political, religious, ethnic and national parties not only made India to learn rules of diplomacy but also provided food for thought to American planners.
LDC_Translation_4: A full and similar reaction of patriotism from all political, religious, linguistic and national parties had, on the one hand, taught India the etiquette of diplomacy, and at the same time, it provided American strategists one more chance to think.

LDC_Translation_1: Muttahida and ANP are responsible for the deterioration of the situation of Karachi, and the administration is being biased.
LDC_Translation_2: Mutahiddah and ANP are responsible for the bad situation in Karachi, whereas the administration is partially.
LDC_Translation_3: The responsibility for the worsening of the situation in Karachi lies on Muttahida and ANP and the administration is taking sides.
LDC_Translation_4: The Alliance and the ANP are responsible for the bad situation in Karachi, and the administration is also being partial in this matter.

LDC_Translation_1: The administration can control the situation in an hour, but it is consciously adding fuel to the fire.
LDC_Translation_2: The administration can control the situation within one hour, but they are intentionally backing it
LDC_Translation_3: The administration can control situation in 1 hour but this is being aggravated on purpose,
LDC_Translation_4: The administration could control the situation in one hour, but it has been ignored and provoked intentionally.

LDC_Translation_1: Police and Rangers avoid taking any action due to the pressure of the political parties.
LDC_Translation_2: It avoids taking action due to pressure on the police and the rangers from the political parties.
LDC_Translation_3: due to the pressure of political parties on police and rangers, it refrains from taking action.
LDC_Translation_4: There is political pressure on police and rangers, because of which they avoid taking action.

LDC_Translation_1: The talk of unity is only limited to talk. Political parties should forget about their political gains and work for the betterment of the common man.
LDC_Translation_2: The talks about unity are limited only to giving statements; political parties should leave their own interests and work for the well-being of the common man.
LDC_Translation_3: The talks of solidarity are restricted to statements only. The political parties should shun their interests and work for the benefit of the common man.
LDC_Translation_4: Unity is just a part of speeches; political parties should work for the benefit of common people rather than for their own good.

LDC_Translation_1: As long as the administration has political pressure on it, these type of incidences will keep taking place. May Allah protect Pakistan.
LDC_Translation_2: As long as the political pressure on the administration continues, similar incidents will happen; may Allah keep Pakistan under His protection.
LDC_Translation_3: As long as the political pressure remains on the administration, such incidents will keep taking place. May God keep Pakistan under His watch.
LDC_Translation_4: These situations will keep surfacing until there is political pressure on the administration.

LDC_Translation_1: I think the people themselves are the greatest terrorists.
LDC_Translation_2: In my opinion these are the biggest terrorists.
LDC_Translation_3: I think these guys are the biggest terrorists.
LDC_Translation_4: According to me, these people are the biggest terrorists.

LDC_Translation_1: And there are surely some foreign forces involved in this, but we don't know who they are.
LDC_Translation_2: And essentially some foreign powers are involved in this, but we don't know who is that?
LDC_Translation_3: And there must be some foreign powers involved in it though we do not know who they are.
LDC_Translation_4: And certainly there are external powers behind it, but we are not aware who they are.

LDC_Translation_1: Sadly, had this situation taken place in some city of the Frontier Province, the government would have laid it to waste, but since it is not in the Northwest Province, the government appears to be helpless.
LDC_Translation_2: But sorry to say that if there has been a similar situation in any of the cities in Frontier, the government would have treated it roughly. Since it is not in Frontier, the government looks helpless.
LDC_Translation_3: But the sad part is that if such a situation had been prevailing in some city of the Frontier, the government would have crushed it. But now that this situation does not relate to the Frontier, the government seems powerless.
LDC_Translation_4: But the contradiction is if such a situation occurs in a border area, the government leaves no stone unturned to curb it, but if the same happens in a city and not a border area, the government looks helpless.

LDC_Translation_1: The government should carry out an operation here and save a big and important city from terrorism.
LDC_Translation_2: The government must initiate an operation here to save the largest and important city of the country from terrorism.
LDC_Translation_3: The government should conduct an operation here and save a large and important city of the country from terrorism.
LDC_Translation_4: The government should start its operations here and save one of the biggest and important cities of the country.

LDC_Translation_1: Otherwise, Pakistan will face a major financial crisis.
LDC_Translation_2: Otherwise, Pakistan will have to face a big financial crisis.
LDC_Translation_3: Otherwise Pakistan will face a huge financial crisis.
LDC_Translation_4: Otherwise Pakistan will face a huge financial crisis.

LDC_Translation_1: Finally, in Karachi, another tale of brutality registered the fear that every citizen had been feeling for quite some time.

LDC_Translation_1: Everyone did what they felt like, without restraint. The reports that reached us through the media are just 50 percent of what happened here in four days.
LDC_Translation_2: Everyone did his best and spared no effort. The facts reported on media are only 50% of what actually happened here during the four days.

LDC_Translation_1: Considering the heart-rendering Mumbai carnage, we do not need to delve too deeply into the situation to find reasons for this violence in Karachi. The straight and simple reason is that this violence happened because of some subconscious boiling of "blood."
LDC_Translation_2: Keeping before us the heart-shaking carnage in Mumbai, we don't have to dive deep at all to find out the cause of unrest in Karachi, but the simple and easy reason is that the unrest is caused unconsciously as a result of blood's uncontrolled motion.
LDC_Translation_3: Keeping in mind the dreadful killing spree in Mumbai, we do not have to search too deep for the cause of Karachi's turmoil. The straightforward and easy explanation is that this turmoil has unconsciously occurred because of strife in 'blood'.
LDC_Translation_4: We don't need to get into India's shattering incident of killings in Mumbai. The easy and plain reason is that this violence happened unconsciously and because of a stir in the 'blood'.

LDC_Translation_1: It is obvious, if someone picks a fight with the "father," then his "son" getting out of control at this should not come as a surprise.

LDC_Translation_1: It was built by Liaqat Ali Khan and many others who sacrificed their lives, who were from there. To remove Mr. Saiko's misconception, I'm writing this verse.
