LDC_Translation_1: Ejaz Awan
LDC_Translation_2: Ejaz Awan
LDC_Translation_3: Ejaz Awan
LDC_Translation_4: Ajaz Awan

LDC_Translation_1: Sir, before you gather a crowd of purveyors of obscenity overnight, let me tell you that the signs of real trouble makers can be seen these days as graffiti and posters on the walls of Karachi.
LDC_Translation_2: Sir, before you, too, gather a huge crowd of proposers within a night, I must tell you that the open signs of real wickedness are these days seen on the walls of Karachi in the shape of wall writings and posters.
LDC_Translation_3: Sir, before you too gather a crowd of the advisors in no time, let me tell you that the blatant symbols of true hoodlumism are found in the form of wall chalking and the posters on the walls of Karachi.
LDC_Translation_4: Sir, before you gather opinion makers, I would like to say to you that you can see open evidence of real mischief on the walls of Karachi, in the form of wall chalking and posters.

LDC_Translation_1: We have been suffering from the mischief of both types.
LDC_Translation_2: We have been experiencing both types of wickedness.
LDC_Translation_3: We have been suffering both kinds of hoodlumism.
LDC_Translation_4: We have been suffering both kinds of mischief.

LDC_Translation_1: Mischief makers did not leave Pakistan or even the founder of Pakistan alone; they did not have to face any consequences.
LDC_Translation_2: The wicked people have not spared Pakistan and the founder of Pakistan; they did not have to face any reaction.
LDC_Translation_3: The ruffians did not even forgive Pakistan and its founder. They did not have to suffer any reaction.
LDC_Translation_4: These rascals have not even left Pakistan and the father of Pakistan- they never faced any reaction of any type.

LDC_Translation_1: On the contrary, they're flourishing at the expense of Pakistan.
LDC_Translation_2: They are still plundering the same Pakistan.
LDC_Translation_3: Rather they are still defiling Pakistan.
LDC_Translation_4: On the contrary, they are creating problems for Pakistan.

LDC_Translation_1: Only Muslim League (N) was left. It also prepared a draft of the eighteenth amendment and handed it over to the People's Party.
LDC_Translation_2: Only Muslim League N was left, but it too drafted and handed over the Eighteenth Amendment bill to the Peoples Party.
LDC_Translation_3: Only the Muslin League (N) remained and now they too have handed a manuscript of the 18th amendment to the Peoples Party.
LDC_Translation_4: There was once a Muslim League (N). It also has documented an 18th Amendment and given it to the People's Party.

LDC_Translation_1: Before this, MQM and Muslim League (Q) had already submitted drafts of the eighteenth amendment in the National Assembly and the Senate.
LDC_Translation_2: Before this, MQM and Muslim League Q have submitted their draft Eighteenth Amendment bills to the National Assembly and the Senate.
LDC_Translation_3: Before this, MQM and the Muslim League (Q) had submitted manuscripts of the 18th amendment in the National Assembly and the Senate.
LDC_Translation_4: Earlier, the MQM and the Muslim League (Q) had submitted an 18th Amendment Bill in the National Assembly and Senate.

LDC_Translation_1: Until now, it appears as if these drafts of the eighteenth amendment are a political ruse and no one is sincere about getting this amendment approved.
LDC_Translation_2: So far, it seems that drafts for the Eighteenth Amendment are political tricks, and no one is sincere in getting this amendment approved.
LDC_Translation_3: It seems so far that the manuscripts for the 18th amendment are only a political gimmick and no one sincerely wants to have it passed.
LDC_Translation_4: Until now, it seems that the 18th Amendment is only a political gimmick, and no one is sincere in getting it passed.

LDC_Translation_1: This is why no one has spoken up on the floor of the Assembly or Senate in support of this amendment nor forced the House to approve this amendment.
LDC_Translation_2: This is because of the same reason that no one has so far made any hue and cry in favor of this amendment on the floor of the Assembly or the Senate and forced the houses to approve this amendment.
LDC_Translation_3: That is why no one has either vociferously talked about it on the Assembly or the Senate floor or pushed the house to endorse it.
LDC_Translation_4: This is the reason why no one has created any uproar about this bill in the Assembly or the Senate floor to pressure the house to get this bill passed.

LDC_Translation_1: It seems as if by submitting the drafts of the eighteenth amendment, these parties have completed a formality that will allow them to say tomorrow that, well, we did submit the amendment. It was the government speaker who did not take action.
LDC_Translation_2: It appears that after submitting the draft Eighteenth Amendment, these parties have created a proof of their effort, which means they are now able to tell the people tomorrow that they had submitted the amendment, but the speaker of the government party did not process it.
LDC_Translation_3: It seems as if these parties have hoodwinked people by submitting the manuscripts of the 18th amendment. This means that they have got the justification now that they had submitted the amendment and it was the ruling party's Speaker who did not initiate proceedings on it.
LDC_Translation_4: It seems that, by only submitting the amendment bill, they cleared the air and can say that they had submitted the amendment but the government had not acted on it.

LDC_Translation_1: MQM, the government's ally; Muslim League (N), the government's ally behind the scenes; and Muslim League (Q), the party that got the seventeenth amendment passed - how then can these parties be sincere in getting the seventeenth amendment annulled?
LDC_Translation_2: MQM is a coalition partner of the government, Muslim league N is a hidden ally of the government, whereas Muslim League Q is a party responsible for passing the Seventeenth Amendment. How, then, can it be possible for these parties to be sincere in doing away with the Seventeenth Amendment.
LDC_Translation_3: MQM is the ally of the government while the Muslim League (N) is the hidden ally and the Muslim League (Q) is the party that passed the 17th amendment, how can these parties be sincere in repealing the 17th amendment.
LDC_Translation_4: The MQM is an ally of the government, the Muslim League (N) is supporting it from behind, and the Muslim League (Q) is the party which will get the 17th Amendment passed. Then how it is possible that these parties are sincere about abolishing the 17th Amendment?

LDC_Translation_1: This is a way for them to appear to be martyrs.
LDC_Translation_2: This is clearly an excuse to claim a big reward for a marginal effort.
LDC_Translation_3: This is sheer cheating.
LDC_Translation_4: This is just eyewash.

LDC_Translation_1: The People's Party is in no hurry to get the seventeenth amendment annulled anyway.
LDC_Translation_2: Anyway, the Peoples Party is not in a hurry to eliminate the Seventeenth Amendment.
LDC_Translation_3: In any case, Peoples Party is in no hurry to repeal the 17th amendment.
LDC_Translation_4: As it is, the People's Party is not in a hurry to abolish the 17th Amendment.

LDC_Translation_1: Why would anyone want to get their own hands cut off?
LDC_Translation_2: How can one think of cutting his own hands.
LDC_Translation_3: How can one think of cutting one's own hands?
LDC_Translation_4: How can one think of getting his own hands chopped off?

LDC_Translation_1: As long as Zardari is president, the seventeenth amendment is not about to be annulled.
LDC_Translation_2: As long as Zardari is president, the Seventeenth Amendment is unlikely to be done away with.
LDC_Translation_3: As long as Zardari is the president, the 17th amendment won't be repealed.
LDC_Translation_4: The 17th Amendment cannot be abolished as long as Zardari is there.

LDC_Translation_1: This was the majority opinion in one of our surveys, and it's true as well.
LDC_Translation_2: This was the majority opinion in one of our surveys and this is true as well.
LDC_Translation_3: This precisely was the opinion of the majority of the people in one of our recent surveys and this is also the truth.
LDC_Translation_4: This is what majority of us said in a survey, and this only is true.

LDC_Translation_1: If the seventeenth amendment had been annulled, Zardari would have never become president.
LDC_Translation_2: Zardari would not have become the President if there had been any intention to do away with the Seventeenth Amendment.
LDC_Translation_3: Had they wanted to repeal the 17th amendment, Zardari would not have become the president.
LDC_Translation_4: If the 17th Amendment had been abolished, Zardari would have never become President.

LDC_Translation_1: Now he is even more powerful than President Musharraf because he, along with being the president, is also the chair of the People's Party.
LDC_Translation_2: Now he is even stronger than President Pervez, because in addition to being President, he is also the Peoples Party Chairperson.
LDC_Translation_3: Now, he is even stronger than President Pervez because he is the President and the chairman of the Peoples Party simultaneously.
LDC_Translation_4: Now he is more powerful than Pervez Musharraf because he is not only the President but also the Chairman of People's Party.

LDC_Translation_1: As long as he is president, the seventeenth amendment will remain in place.
LDC_Translation_2: The Seventeenth Amendment will stay as long as he is the President.
LDC_Translation_3: As long as he remains the President, the 17th amendment will stand.
LDC_Translation_4: As long as he is the President, the 17th Amendment will remain intact.

LDC_Translation_1: To get rid of the seventeenth amendment, political parties will first have to get President Zardari out of the presidential house.
LDC_Translation_2: Before eliminating the Seventeenth Amendment, the political parties will have to make President Zardari say goodbye to the President House.
LDC_Translation_3: Before repealing the 17th amendment, the political parties will have to banish President Zardari from the presidential palace.
LDC_Translation_4: To abolish the 17th Amendment, political parties will have to remove President Zardari from the Presidential House first.

LDC_Translation_1: This is something neither MQM nor the other parties wants.
LDC_Translation_2: Neither MQM nor other parties want this.
LDC_Translation_3: Neither MQM wants so nor do the other parties.
LDC_Translation_4: Neither the MQM nor other parties wants it.

LDC_Translation_1: Most of the elders of my family belong to the working class.
LDC_Translation_2: The majority of the elders in my family belonged to the labor class
LDC_Translation_3: Most of the elders of my family belonged to labor class
LDC_Translation_4: Most of our ancestors belonged to the labor class,

LDC_Translation_1: When I used to see my paternal and maternal uncles and the rest of them working for daily wages, I used to pray in my heart that God would save me from such physically rigorous labor.
LDC_Translation_2: and when we used to see our paternal and maternal uncles doing the job of a daily laborer, a wish in our heart always prompted us to request Allah to keep us away from the work involving physical labor.
LDC_Translation_3: and when in my childhood I used to watch my paternal and maternal uncles doing menial labor, I used to pray to God to spare me from such physical hardship.
LDC_Translation_4: and in our childhood, when we used to see our uncles and maternal uncles selling things on handcarts, we would pray to Allah to save us from physical labor.

LDC_Translation_1: To get out of this, I wrote a letter to the editor of the Amroze daily newspaper and asked what I should do after graduation so that I don't have to do hard labor.
LDC_Translation_2: To be saved from this, I wrote a letter to the editor of Daily Imroz asking him what to do after Matric so as to avoid physical labor.
LDC_Translation_3: To avoid this, I wrote a letter to the editor of Daily Imroz and asked him what I should do after matriculation so that I did not have to do hard labor.
LDC_Translation_4: To save us from that, we wrote a letter to the editor of Daily Imroz and asked as to what one should do after Metric to be saved from physical labor.

LDC_Translation_1: The editor wrote back that I should become a doctor or an engineer or take such-and-such subjects.
LDC_Translation_2: The editor in his reply advised to become a doctor or engineer and suggested the reading of specific subjects.
LDC_Translation_3: The editor replied that I should become doctor or engineer and start studying the respective subjects.
LDC_Translation_4: The editor replied that we should become a doctor or an engineer, and suggested a few subjects.

LDC_Translation_1: My inclination had always been towards engineering, and I had even taken technical drawing in school instead of biology.
LDC_Translation_2: From the beginning I was interested in engineering, that is why I studied technical drawing instead of biology.
LDC_Translation_3: From the beginning, I was inclined towards engineering and in the matriculation I had studied Technical Drawing instead of Biology.
LDC_Translation_4: As it is, we were interested in engineering, and we passed our Metric exams in technical drawing, not biology.

LDC_Translation_1: But at the time of the F. Sc. admissions, my older brother forced me to do my F. Sc. in medicine and become a doctor.
LDC_Translation_2: But at the time of admission in F.Sc., my elder brother forced me to become a doctor by doing F.Sc. in pre-medical.
LDC_Translation_3: But at the time of admission in F.Sc., my elder brother forced me to do F.Sc. in pre-medical and become a doctor.
LDC_Translation_4: But when we went to take admission in FSC, my elder brother forced us to take admission in medical FSC and become a doctor.

LDC_Translation_1: I studied biology with difficulty for a month, but when I couldn't make heads or tails of it, I changed the subject and took math instead.
LDC_Translation_2: I barely studied biology for a month, but, being unable to understand it, opted to take up mathematics.
LDC_Translation_3: I studied Biology hardly for one month and when I could not understand a word of it, I exchanged it for Mathematics.
LDC_Translation_4: We hardly studied biology for a month, and when we couldn't understand, we exchanged it for mathematics.

LDC_Translation_1: It means the dread of physical labor made me an engineer and now I have a better job than most of my peers in the family, for which I constantly thank God.
LDC_Translation_2: This means that the fear of physical labor helped me to become an engineer, and now among the family members of the same age group, I am in a comparatively better position for which I am always thankful to God.
LDC_Translation_3: I mean the fear of menial labor made an engineer of me and now I am at a very good position among many of my peers and am always thankful to God for this blessing.
LDC_Translation_4: That means, fear from physical labor had made us engineers, and now we are in a much better position in our family and we thank Allah for that.

LDC_Translation_1: I was reminded of this when I was trying to lift a carpet with our two young sons at our old home.
LDC_Translation_2: This story came to my mind at a time when I, along with my two young sons, was trying to take away the carpets of our old house.
LDC_Translation_3: I was reminded of this when I was trying to lift the carpets from my old home with the help of my two young sons.
LDC_Translation_4: We realized this while we were laying a carpet in our old house with our two young sons.

LDC_Translation_1: Not even half an hour had passed when my younger son said, "Dad, looks like I wasn't made to do this kind of work."
LDC_Translation_2: Hardly half an hour had passed after we started doing this job when my younger son said, "Dad! It seems as if I have not been created for this job."
LDC_Translation_3: We were not even half an hour into the work when the younger son said, "Dad, I think I was not born to do this work".
LDC_Translation_4: We were into the work for about half an hour when my younger son said, "Dad, we are not born to do this it seems."

LDC_Translation_1: I said, "If this is true, then study hard like me and save yourself from having to do hard labor."
LDC_Translation_2: I said if it is true, then work as hard with your study as I did, and then you will get rid of physical labor.
LDC_Translation_3: I said if this were true then he should study diligently like me and get rid of the menial labor.
LDC_Translation_4: We said, "If it is true, then study hard like us and keep away from physical labor."

LDC_Translation_1: My son said, "I am studying and I'll keep doing it, but I can't do this work."
LDC_Translation_2: My son replied that I am studying and will complete it too, but I cannot do this work.
LDC_Translation_3: The son said that he was studying and would complete his studies but he could not do that kind of work.
LDC_Translation_4: The son said, "I am studying and will study but I cannot do this work."

LDC_Translation_1: We got the job done as best we could in three hours and returned home.
LDC_Translation_2: All three of us finished this job by hook or by crook in three hours and returned home.
LDC_Translation_3: Somehow, the three of us completed that work in three hours and returned home.
LDC_Translation_4: We finished that work somehow in three hours.

LDC_Translation_1: The point is that if a man sets his sights on something, whatever his reason is behind that, nothing can stop him from getting what he wants.
LDC_Translation_2: The purpose of telling this story is that if a person has selected his destination with whatever background reasons, no one can stop him from reaching his destination.
LDC_Translation_3: The purpose of narrating this is if one specifies a goal, for whatever reason may there be, nothing could stop him from achieving his goal.
LDC_Translation_4: It is meant to say that if a man decides his destination, no matter what comes his way, no one can stop him from reaching there.

LDC_Translation_1: But if you don't even know what you want to do, only Allah can save you.
LDC_Translation_2: Well if you don't know what to do, then it will be very hard to succeed.
LDC_Translation_3: And well, if you do not know what you want to do, then only God is your savior.
LDC_Translation_4: Yes, if you don't know what to do then only Allah can save you.

LDC_Translation_1: They say not to say bad things about the dead, but what should we do - we see nothing but Benazir's misdeeds even a year after she died.
LDC_Translation_2: It is said that those who have died should not be blamed, but what should be done when we only see faults in Benazir, even at her first death anniversary.
LDC_Translation_3: It is said that we should not speak ill of the deceased but what can we do. Even on the first death anniversary of Benazir, we can only remember her shortcomings.
LDC_Translation_4: It is said that one should not speak ill of the dead, but what could one do when only bad things are seen on the first anniversary of the death of Benazeer?

LDC_Translation_1: For the sake of her own interests, Benazir provided India a list of names of the Sikhs who were fighting for their independence, whereby on the one hand she crushed their independence movement, and on the other she gave India the opportunity to suppress the Punjab movement and focus all its attention on Kashmir.
LDC_Translation_2: Just to safeguard her own interests, Benazir provided the list of Sikh freedom fighters to India and thus on one hand crushed the independence movement of Sikhs and on the other hand allowed India an opportunity to pay full attention to Kashmir after having suppressed the movement in Punjab.
LDC_Translation_3: On the one hand, she crushed the independence movement of the Sikhs by providing the list of Sikh freedom fighters to India for the sake of her interests, and on the other hand she provided India with the chance to focus on Kashmir after crushing the movement in the Punjab.
LDC_Translation_4: On the one hand, Benazeer had arranged the list of Sikhs who were fighting for their freedom in India, and suppressed their movement, and on the other hand, she had given India a chance after suppressing the Punjab movement in order to concentrate on Kashmir.

LDC_Translation_1: It was Benazir and Nawaz Sharif's tug-of-war for power that set the country many years behind.
LDC_Translation_2: The power tussle between Benazir and Nawaz Sharif is a part of history that pushed the country several years back.
LDC_Translation_3: Benazir and Nawaz Sharif's scramble for power which plunged the country many years back is recorded in history.
LDC_Translation_4: The rift of power between Benazeer and Nawaz Shareef is a part of history that has pushed the country many years back.

LDC_Translation_1: Benazir, during her exile, continued to make negative statements about Kashmir and the atomic program.
LDC_Translation_2: During the period of her exile, Benazir continued to issue negative statements about Kashmir and the atomic program.
LDC_Translation_3: Benazir continued the streak of negative statements on Kashmir and the nuclear program during her exile.
LDC_Translation_4: During her banishment, Benazeer continued to give statements against Kashmir and the nuclear program.

LDC_Translation_1: Violating the London agreement she had made with Nawaz Sharif, Benazir made a deal with General Musharraf.
LDC_Translation_2: Violating the agreement signed with Nawaz Sharif in London, Benazir entered into a deal with General Musharraf.
LDC_Translation_3: In violation of the London accord with Nawaz Sharif, Benazir struck a deal with General Musharraf.
LDC_Translation_4: Benazeer had dealt with General Musharraf, dishonoring his agreement with Nawaz Shareef in London.

LDC_Translation_1: Benazir, during her time in office, freely gave her husband the opportunity to make money, and this is why he was called Mr. Ten Percent.
LDC_Translation_2: While in power, Benazir provided her husband with an opportunity to earn money in whatever ways he could, and this is why he was named as Mr. ten percent.
LDC_Translation_3: During her reign, she allowed her husband to openly amass wealth and for this reason, he was called Mr. Ten Percent
LDC_Translation_4: Benazeer, during his tenure, allowed her husband to earn much money. This has earned him the name of Mr. Ten Percent.

LDC_Translation_1: During Benazir's time, her brother was murdered and his murderers have still not been punished.
LDC_Translation_2: While Benazir was in power her brother was murdered, but his killers are still safe from punishment.
LDC_Translation_3: During Benazir's reign, her brother was killed and his killers have not yet been punished.
LDC_Translation_4: Her brother was killed when she was in power, and his assassins are still at large.

LDC_Translation_1: Despite being a woman herself, Benazir avoided fighting for women's rights.
LDC_Translation_2: Despite being a woman, Benazir avoided fighting for the rights of women.
LDC_Translation_3: Although she was a woman, Benazir avoided the fight for woman's rights.
LDC_Translation_4: Being a woman, Benazeer never raised her voice about women's rights.

LDC_Translation_1: In the same way Benazir thrived as a politician because of her father's death, her widowed husband is now thriving as a politician because of hers.
LDC_Translation_2: Just as Benazir did politics on the dead body of her father, in a similar style her widowed husband is doing politics on her dead body.
LDC_Translation_3: Just as Benazir played her politics over her father's corpse, similarly her widower husband is now playing his politics over her corpse.
LDC_Translation_4: The way Benazeer created her politics on her father's dead body, in the same way her widower husband is playing politics on her dead body.

LDC_Translation_1: Benazir got control of the government twice, but she couldn't even file a case against those responsible for her father's political murder, let alone get them punished.
LDC_Translation_2: Benazir came into power twice, but not to talk of giving punishment to those involved in the political murder of her father, she even failed to get a case registered against them.
LDC_Translation_3: Benazir won the government twice but, punishment aside, she could not even get a case registered against the political murderers of her father.
LDC_Translation_4: Benazeer came to power twice, but she could not arrest the political killers of her father, and could not even initiate a case against them.

LDC_Translation_1: It has been 37 years since East Pakistan separated from us, but look at the insensitivity of our people and our rulers - we neither mourned on this day nor lamented our mistakes.
LDC_Translation_2: Thirty-seven years have passed since the separation of East Pakistan from us, and look at the extreme of apathy that our public and rulers have demonstrated by neither mourning nor showing any regrets for their mistakes on this day.
LDC_Translation_3: It has been 37 years since the East Pakistan seceded. And look at the extent of the insensitivity of our people and the rulers that none of them either mourn or repent over their mistakes.
LDC_Translation_4: Thirty-seven years had passed when East Pakistan broke from us, and look at the apathy of our people and leaders that no one even feels sad about it, and no one is beating his chest over a mistake of our own.

LDC_Translation_1: What we should have done was to commemorate December 16 as a lesson and come up with the kinds of strategies that could prevent such a misfortune from recurring.
LDC_Translation_2: We should have celebrated 16 December as a day of admonition and taken measures to prevent the reoccurrence of similar happenings.
LDC_Translation_3: The proper course of action should have been to commemorate December 16 as a day of admonition and we should have made such moves that such an accident would not happen again.
LDC_Translation_4: We should have remembered December 16 as an example and made sure that such things don't happen again.

LDC_Translation_1: We should have sent goodwill messages to the people of Bangladesh on this day and tried to bring them close to us again.
LDC_Translation_2: We should have sent the messages of goodwill on this day to the people of Bangladesh and tried to bring them closer to us again.
LDC_Translation_3: We should have sent goodwill messages to the people of Bangladesh and tried to bring them closer to us again.
LDC_Translation_4: On that day, we could send messages of prosperity to the people of Bangladesh and try again to bring them closer.

LDC_Translation_1: Rulers should have opened the Hamood-ur-Rehman Commission's file and deliberated on the reasons for East Pakistan's separation.
LDC_Translation_2: Rulers should have opened the file of the Hamood-ur-Rahman Commission and pondered upon the reasons for separation of East Pakistan.
LDC_Translation_3: The rulers should have opened the Hamood-ur-Rehman Commission's Report and considered the reasons that led to the secession of East Pakistan.
LDC_Translation_4: Rulers would open Mehmoodurrahman's files and look into the reasons why Eastern Pakistan broke away.

LDC_Translation_1: They should have come up with a strategy for bringing back the Biharis stuck in Bangladesh, and sent them gifts to encourage them.
LDC_Translation_2: We should have taken measures to bring back the stranded Biharis in Bangladesh and sent them gifts for encouragement.
LDC_Translation_3: They should have thought about some way to bring back the Biharis stranded in Bangladesh and sent them gifts for encouragement.
LDC_Translation_4: Efforts should have been made to bring back the Biharis who are still strangled in Bangladesh and would have sent gifts to keep their spirits high.

LDC_Translation_1: But we have become insensitive. If someone dies in our neighborhood, we do not even find out about it.
LDC_Translation_2: But we have turned so senseless that if someone dies in our neighborhood, we have no information about this.
LDC_Translation_3: But we have become insensitive. If someone dies next door, we do not get the information now.
LDC_Translation_4: But we have become insensitive; if someone dies in our neighborhood, we don't know it.

LDC_Translation_1: We don't care about our sisters and brothers anymore because we've become selfish.
LDC_Translation_2: We don't have any concerns for our sisters and brothers because we have become selfish.
LDC_Translation_3: We no more care for our brothers and sisters because we have become selfish.
LDC_Translation_4: We don't care for our brothers and sisters because we have become selfish.

LDC_Translation_1: Even if a great tragedy occurs, the next day we get tied up in our day-to-day affairs.
LDC_Translation_2: Even after the occurrence of the greatest of tragedies, we get deeply occupied the next day with the usual affairs of life.
LDC_Translation_3: No matter how great a tragedy may befall us, we get back to business the next day.
LDC_Translation_4: Regardless of what big tragedy occurs, we go about our lives normally the following day.

LDC_Translation_1: I wish East and West Pakistan could reunite the same way that East and West Germany did.
LDC_Translation_2: Would that as East and West Germany became united again, in a similar style East and West Pakistan too had become united again.
LDC_Translation_3: As the East and West Germany have unified, would that East and West Pakistan could unify once again.
LDC_Translation_4: The way East and West Germany became one, I wish East and West Pakistan would become one again.

LDC_Translation_1: We can be one again if both make sacrifices for each other and break out of the shell of selfishness.
LDC_Translation_2: We can become united again if we sacrifice for each other and get out of the shell of selfishness.
LDC_Translation_3: We can again unify if both sacrifice for each other and come out of the shell of selfishness.
LDC_Translation_4: We can once again become one if both sacrifice for each other and come out of the shell of selfishness.

LDC_Translation_1: But it doesn't look like this wish will be fulfilled anytime in the near future.
LDC_Translation_2: But this desire is not likely to be fulfilled in the near future.
LDC_Translation_3: But I do not see this wish coming true in the near future.
LDC_Translation_4: But this desire doesn't seem likely to be fulfilled in the near future.

LDC_Translation_1: Today, when it was stated in the news that the governor of the American state of Illinois was arrested on charges of corruption
LDC_Translation_2: News came in today's broadcast saying that the Governor of the State of Illinois in the United States has been arrested for corruption charges.
LDC_Translation_3: When it was reported in the news today that the Governor of the American state Illinois had been arrested on corruption charges
LDC_Translation_4: Today's news revealed that the Governor of the American state of Illinois has been arrested under corruption charges.

LDC_Translation_1: and that to take him out of office, the Provincial Congress has started to make preparations to call him to account as soon as possible, one of our white American friends who keeps a close watch on the situation in Pakistan challenged us as he boasted, "See, this is what democracy is."
LDC_Translation_2: To remove him from the governorship, the provincial congress has moved very quickly with the preparation for his accountability. An American white man who keeps a careful eye on Pakistan's affairs boastfully challenged me by citing this example of democracy.
LDC_Translation_3: and as the state congress was preparing for his impeachment at the earliest to remove him from the governorship, a white American friend of mine who keeps a keen eye on the situation in Pakistan bragged to me that this was called democracy.
LDC_Translation_4: Provincial Congress is preparing to hold him accountable and remove him from the post of Governor. One of our American white friends who keeps an eye on the situation in Pakistan challenged us proudly and said, "Look, this is democracy."

LDC_Translation_1: Not even the most important person in America is above the law.
LDC_Translation_2: In America, even the powerful are not above the law.
LDC_Translation_3: Even the strongest man is not above law in America
LDC_Translation_4: In America, even the biggest man is not above the law,

LDC_Translation_1: And then we have your country, Pakistan, where even the president came into office only after getting the corruption charges dropped.
LDC_Translation_2: And in your country Pakistan, even the president came into power after getting corruption charges dropped against himself.
LDC_Translation_3: and then there is your country Pakistan whose President has taken office only after getting the corruption charges against him dropped.
LDC_Translation_4: and there is your country Pakistan whose President got his charges dropped to become the President.

LDC_Translation_1: I took it with a sense of humor and said, "So what if one governor was arrested in America? In our Pakistan, the prime minister was arrested and hanged overnight one time, and another one was sent into exile.
LDC_Translation_2: I responded in a joking way, saying that the arrest of a governor in America is totally worthless if compared with Pakistan, where one prime minister was arrested and hanged and another was exiled in no time.
LDC_Translation_3: Our sense of humor was stirred and we replied that the arrest of one Governor in America was not a big deal since in our country one prime minister was arrested and hanged overnight and the other one was exiled in no time.
LDC_Translation_4: My witty nature did not let me take a back seat, so I said, so what if one governor is arrested in America? In our Pakistan, one Prime Minister was arrested in the night to be hanged and other was banished.

LDC_Translation_1: Tell me, did this ever happen in America?"
LDC_Translation_2: Tell me if this has even happened in America.
LDC_Translation_3: Tell us if such a thing had ever happened in America?
LDC_Translation_4: Tell me if this has ever happened in America?

LDC_Translation_1: Pakistan gave a guard of honor to a president who broke the national law as he left his house. Tell me, did this ever happen in America?
LDC_Translation_2: In Pakistan, the one who broke the constitution was offered a guard of honor before his departure from the presidential palace; tell me if this has ever happened in America?
LDC_Translation_3: Pakistan saw off the President from the presidential palace with guard of honor who had dismissed the constitution of the country? Tell us if it had ever happened in America?
LDC_Translation_4: Pakistan had awarded the badge of honor to a law breaker before his departure from the presidential house; tell me if this has ever happened in America?

LDC_Translation_1: In Pakistan, the chief justice was suspended in such a way that, despite having popular support, he still has not been reinstated. Did this ever happen in America?
LDC_Translation_2: In Pakistan, the Chief Justice was suspended, and despite public support, he has not been reinstated up to now; has this happened in America?
LDC_Translation_3: In Pakistan, the Chief Justice was dismissed in such a way that despite having public support he has not yet been reinstated. Has it happened in America?
LDC_Translation_4: In Pakistan, the Chief Justice was removed, and could not be reinstated even with popular support. Has this ever happened in America?

LDC_Translation_1: The holder of a counterfeit degree was made the Minister of Health in Pakistan. Did this ever happen in America?
LDC_Translation_2: In Pakistan, a fake degree holder was made the minister for health, has this happened in America?
LDC_Translation_3: A fake degree holder was appointed health minister in Pakistan. Did it ever happen in America?
LDC_Translation_4: In Pakistan, a fake degree holder was made the Minister of Health. Has this ever happened in America?

LDC_Translation_1: When he heard this, the poor American laughed hysterically as he accepted his defeat.
LDC_Translation_2: After listening to this, the poor American laughed too much and accepted his defeat.
LDC_Translation_3: The poor American laughed himself out and conceded his defeat.
LDC_Translation_4: Hearing this, the American fell down laughing and accepted his defeat.

LDC_Translation_1: In this photograph, President Zardari is smiling even though he is surrounded on all four sides by Americans.
LDC_Translation_2: Despite being surrounded by the Americans from all four sides, President Zardari is still smiling in this picture.
LDC_Translation_3: In this photograph, despite being surrounded on all sides by the Americans, President Zardari is smiling.
LDC_Translation_4: In this picture, President Zardari is smiling even when he is surrounded by Americans.

LDC_Translation_1: He is smiling as if
LDC_Translation_2: His smile is an indication
LDC_Translation_3: It appears from his smile
LDC_Translation_4: His smile indicates

LDC_Translation_1: he thinks that America is in favor of his government, but he is forgetting that a year ago the same people were in favor of Pervez Musharraf.
LDC_Translation_2: of his feeling that America is backing his government, but he is forgetting that a year ago the same people were supporting Pervez Musharraf.
LDC_Translation_3: as if he thinks that America is with his government but he is forgetting that these same people were with Pervez Musharraf a year ago.
LDC_Translation_4: that he thinks that America is with his government, but perhaps he forgot that these are the same people who were with Parvez Musharraf a year ago.

LDC_Translation_1: This photograph has been taken just like a family picture.
LDC_Translation_2: The picture has been portrayed as if it is a family picture.
LDC_Translation_3: This photograph has been posed for as if it were a family photo.
LDC_Translation_4: This picture was taken as if it is a family portrait.

LDC_Translation_1: Before this, such a photograph with one president and six American officials was never allowed to be published.
LDC_Translation_2: This type of picture, showing three American delegates with a president, has not been published in the newspapers before.
LDC_Translation_3: Never has such a photo been published in a newspaper before this. That is one president with three American officials.
LDC_Translation_4: There was no such picture, a President with three American officials published in the newspapers earlier.

LDC_Translation_1: It seems as if America's work in Pakistan has increased so much that not just one official can take care of it, they have to team up - either that or they don't trust their new slave the way they trusted the one before him.
LDC_Translation_2: It seems the American responsibility has increased in Pakistan and now it needs more than one employee to carry it out, or the level of their trust on the new slave is not as high as was for the previous one.
LDC_Translation_3: It seems as if America's workload has increased in Pakistan and she has to do it with more than one workers. Or it may be so that they don't trust the new slave as much as they did the previous one.
LDC_Translation_4: It seems the work for America in Pakistan has increased and they want more than one person to finish it, or they do not trust this slave more than they believed the earlier one.

LDC_Translation_1: It could also be that this arrangement was made while keeping in mind President Zardari's notoriety for going back on his promises.
LDC_Translation_2: It may also be possible that, keeping in view President Zardari's reputation of backtracking, they had to make this arrangement.
LDC_Translation_3: It is also possible that this arrangement had been made keeping in view the notoriety of President Zardari's reneging.
LDC_Translation_4: It is also possible that Zardari's promise-breaking stories have reached them, and so they made an allowance for that.

LDC_Translation_1: Had it been some sensible ruler, at least he would not have sported such a smile in the photograph; at least there would have been some shame on his face because of the collar of slavery he's wearing.
LDC_Translation_2: If there has been a sensible leader, he would at least have avoided putting his teeth on show and, his face would obviously have exhibited the shame of slavery.
LDC_Translation_3: Had there been some wise ruler, he would have not given a smile in this photograph and the shame over the yoke of slavery would have been visible on his face.
LDC_Translation_4: A sincere ruler would not have shown his teeth in the picture, and he would at least have a little shame on his face for being a slave.

LDC_Translation_1: If the principle of democracy is applied to this photograph, President Zardari is in the minority.
LDC_Translation_2: If the principle of democracy is applied to this picture, then President Zardari is in the minority.
LDC_Translation_3: If the principle of democracy is applied to this photograph, President Zardari would find himself in the minority.
LDC_Translation_4: If one applies the rules of democracy to this picture, Zardari is in the minority.

LDC_Translation_1: In a democracy, only a majority rules the country, and this photograph shows who the majority is.
LDC_Translation_2: In accordance with democracy, only the majority has a government in the country, and who is that this picture is telling.
LDC_Translation_3: According to the democracy, only majority rules the country and the photograph tells who is in majority.
LDC_Translation_4: In a democracy, majority rules the country. And who is a majority? The picture speaks a lot about it.

LDC_Translation_1: The heavenly Swat is also called the Switzerland of Pakistan.
LDC_Translation_2: The paradise like Sawat is also called Pakistan's Switzerland.
LDC_Translation_3: The heavenly Swat is also called the Switzerland of Pakistan.
LDC_Translation_4: Heavenly Swat is called the Switzerland of Pakistan.

LDC_Translation_1: Until now, according to government strategy, negotiations are being held along with the use of power.
LDC_Translation_2: So far, as per governmental strategy, negotiations are continuing along with the use of force.
LDC_Translation_3: According to the government strategy so far, the talks are being conducted along with the use of force.
LDC_Translation_4: As per the government's strategy, talks are in progress at the same time force is also being used.

LDC_Translation_1: But the use of force is having no benefit other than to increase the strength of the Taliban and create sympathy for them among the people.
LDC_Translation_2: But the use of force is not giving any paybacks, except helping to increase the Taliban's strength and creating sympathies for them among the public.
LDC_Translation_3: But the use of force has been of no use except further enhancing the Taliban's power and creating sympathy for them among the public.
LDC_Translation_4: But the use of force is only increasing the power of the Taliban; there is a sympathy among the people for them, but there is no benefit beyond it.

LDC_Translation_1: There is a need for the government to eliminate the reasons for this problem instead of using force.
LDC_Translation_2: What is needed is that instead of using force, the government should eliminate the causes of this problem.
LDC_Translation_3: It is needed that the government addresses the causes of the problem rather than using the force.
LDC_Translation_4: The need of the hour is to use no force, but to finish the root cause of it.

LDC_Translation_1: By eliminating the reasons, Fazlullah and the Taliban will fall apart on their own.
LDC_Translation_2: By eliminating the causes, Fazlullah and the Taliban will be eliminated automatically.
LDC_Translation_3: If the causes are addressed, Fazlullah and the Taliban will automatically vanish.
LDC_Translation_4: If the root cause is ended, people like Fazlullah and the Taliban will be finished on their own.

LDC_Translation_1: The Sharia Bill proposed by the ANP government will go a long way to help solve the problems of Swat.
LDC_Translation_2: The Shariah bill proposed by the ANP Government will solve Sawat problems to a greater extent.
LDC_Translation_3: The proposed Shariat bill from the ANP government will, to a great extent, provide the solution to the problems of Swat.
LDC_Translation_4: The proposed Sharia Bill by ANP will solve the problems of Swat to a large extent.

LDC_Translation_1: But along with enforcing Sharia, the government will also need to focus on the economic problems.
LDC_Translation_2: But along with the enforcement of Shariah, the government shall also side by side have to pay attention to the economic issues
LDC_Translation_3: But along with the implementation of Shariat, the government will have to focus on the economic problems too
LDC_Translation_4: But with the implementation of Sharia law, the government should also pay heed to financial problems.

LDC_Translation_1: From the initial steps taken by General Musharraf, it looked like the nation might be rid of incompetent politicians but the lust for power changed all his plans.
LDC_Translation_2: It appeared on the basis of initial steps taken by Musharraf that perhaps this nation will be liberated from incapable politicians, but the lust for power changed all his intentions
LDC_Translation_3: The initial steps taken by General Musharraf suggested that this nation might get rid of the unworthy politicians but the lust for power transformed all his intentions
LDC_Translation_4: The initial steps taken by General Musharraf started to give one a feeling that the nation will now get rid of these inefficient politicians, but his greed for power has changed all of his aspirations.

LDC_Translation_1: Whatever the hopes were in becoming a part of the "war of terror" he started thinking of himself as truly immortal
LDC_Translation_2: whatever the expectations were, his participation in the 'war on terror' made him think that he has become an invincible man
LDC_Translation_3: whatever the hopes were, after joining the 'war of terror', he actually began to consider himself immortal
LDC_Translation_4: He started to think of himself as invincible after joining "The War On Terror," doing whatever was expected.

LDC_Translation_1: and the expected steps he would take were disappointed.
LDC_Translation_2: and the measures that were expected from him disappeared.
LDC_Translation_3: and expectations of taking certain steps ended.
LDC_Translation_4: And the measures that were expected, shattered.

LDC_Translation_1: Just like when Bush's term in office was coming to an end, he started worrying about the end of his power and in the confusion made a deal with thieves.
LDC_Translation_2: As the government of Bush started coming to an end, Musharraf started feeling concerned about the end of his rule and in a state of perturbation he entered into a deal with thieves.
LDC_Translation_3: As the Bush era neared its end, he began to worry about the end of his regime and signed a deal with the thieves in panic.
LDC_Translation_4: As Bush's tenure came to an end, he also became worried about the end of his government and quickly dealt with thieves.

LDC_Translation_1: General Musharraf could still control the army but the current government does not even know what is happening.
LDC_Translation_2: General Musharraf could control the army, but the current government does not know what is going on.
LDC_Translation_3: General Musharraf could nevertheless have controlled the military but the present government does not even know what is happening.
LDC_Translation_4: Even after that, General Musharraf could have controlled the army, but who knows what is happening with the present government?

LDC_Translation_1: Be it Bajaur or Swat, the army does not control terror and bombs the people, causing physical loss and loss of property, making the "enemy" a mental patient, which means we are the enemy.
LDC_Translation_2: Whether it is Bajur or Sawat, the army cannot control terrorists and resort to shelling on the 'enemy' - i.e. the public - which in addition to resulting in losses to human lives and material also making people psychologically sick; so who is the enemy except us!
LDC_Translation_3: Whether it be Bajaur or Swat, the army does not control the terrorism. And it bombs the 'enemy' i.e. 'the people'. It harms the life and finances of the 'enemy', as well as make them psychotic. That means we are the enemies
LDC_Translation_4: Whether it is Bajod or Swat, the government is not controlling terror, but rather bombarding its "enemies"; this not only damages property, but also makes the "enemy" a mental patient. Then, only we are their enemies.

LDC_Translation_1: In spite of army operations underway for over a year in the Frontier Province's insurgency-ridden area of Swat, the situation has been going from bad to worse.
LDC_Translation_2: In the troubled area of Sawat in the Frontier province, even with the continuing military operations for the last one year, the situation is increasingly becoming worse.
LDC_Translation_3: The conditions are steadily getting worse in the troubled areas of Swat in the Frontier province despite the military operation that has been going on for more than a year.
LDC_Translation_4: One year of army action has passed in the disturbed border province of Swat, and the situation is going from bad to worse.

LDC_Translation_1: On the one hand, the government's writ in this area has been reduced to approving condemnatory resolutions in the National Assembly; on the other, Taliban's illegal FM radio channel's influence seems to be increasing in Swat.
LDC_Translation_2: On one hand, writ of the government in this area is now limited only to passing a condemnation resolution in the National Assembly, whereas on the other hand, the influence of the Taliban's illegal FM radio channel is significantly increasing in Sawat.
LDC_Translation_3: On the one hand, the government's writ in this area has been reduced to passage of a resolution of condemnation in the National Assembly and on the other hand the influence of the illegal FM radio channel of the Taliban has been steadily increasing in Swat.
LDC_Translation_4: On the one hand, the government is limited in this area to repeating to move a condemnation writ in the national assembly, and on the other hand, Taliban's illegal FM Radio is enjoying immense popularity in Swat.

LDC_Translation_1: Thirdly, the common citizen thinks the only way to be safe is to listen to whoever has the power in the area.
LDC_Translation_2: Thirdly, a common man deems it safe to be showing submissiveness to those who are practically in control of this area.
LDC_Translation_3: The third aspect is that the ordinary citizen finds it convenient to obey the person who is ruling the area.
LDC_Translation_4: Thirdly, common citizens find it fit to obey the one who is practically in charge of this area.

LDC_Translation_1: During the operations in Swat carried out by security forces, it is claimed that gunship helicopters and bombings of arsenals killed many extremists, but in spite of these killings, not only has the Taliban grown stronger - according to one estimate, their control has been established in 80 percent of Swat.
LDC_Translation_2: In Sawat, killing of extremists is claimed as a result of shelling from gunship helicopters and artillery fires during security forces operations, but even with these killings, the Taliban have not only gathered more strength, but, according to an estimate, they are in control of 80% of the Sawat area.
LDC_Translation_3: The claims are made about the deaths of many extremists in Swat by the gunship helicopters and in the artillery fire in the operation being conducted by the security forces. But despite these deaths, not only have the Taliban consolidated even further but according to one estimate, their control has spread to almost eighty percent of Swat.
LDC_Translation_4: In Swat, during the operations of security forces, they claimed to kill ..... fundamentals through their gunship helicopters and cannons, but despite these killings, the Taliban is not only becoming stronger but, according to an estimate, are practically ruling eighty percent of Swat.

LDC_Translation_1: In conclusion, the government is not ready to accept its failure, and the Taliban is stronger.
LDC_Translation_2: The result is that on one hand, the government is not ready to accept its failures, and on the other hand, the Taliban are strong.
LDC_Translation_3: Consequently, on the one hand the government is not prepared to concede its failure and on the other hand, the Taliban are more stable.
LDC_Translation_4: The result is, while the government is not ready to accept its defeat, the Taliban is well established there.

LDC_Translation_1: The ones who got stuck in the middle were the poor citizens.
LDC_Translation_2: Who is being crushed in between - the poor citizens!
LDC_Translation_3: And who has been crushed between the two: the ordinary citizens.
LDC_Translation_4: Who is caught between the line of fire? Poor citizens.

LDC_Translation_1: It is said that someone in Swat asked what kind of people Taliban members are - the answer came that they are very good people because they are protectors of religion and they fight against the "enemies of Allah and religion."
LDC_Translation_2: In Sawat someone asked how are the Taliban? The reply came that they are very good, because they are the custodians of Allah's code of life and are fighting against 'enemies of Allah and the religion of Allah'.
LDC_Translation_3: It is said in Swat now that someone asked what kind of people Taliban were and the reply came that they were very good since they were the guardians of the faith and were fighting the 'enemies of God and religion'.
LDC_Translation_4: In Swat, it is now said, someone asked what kind of people are Taliban. Another answered, very good, because they are the custodians of religion and fight against the 'enemies of Allah and religion.'

LDC_Translation_1: When asked what the army is like, the answer came that it's very good because it "protects our homeland" and fights against "the country's enemies."
LDC_Translation_2: Another question was asked, how is army? The answer received said very well, because it is 'defending the country and fighting against the enemies of the country'.
LDC_Translation_3: Then they were asked about the army and the reply was that the army was good because it 'guarded the country and fought against the enemies of the state'.
LDC_Translation_4: Again asked, how is the army? Someone answered, very good because they 'defend the country and fight against the enemies of the country.'

LDC_Translation_1: Then when asked who the enemies of religion and our homeland are; the answer came "we the citizens."
LDC_Translation_2: Then it was asked who is the enemy of Allah's Code of life and the country? The reply was "we the public".
LDC_Translation_3: Then it was asked who were the enemies of the religion and the country and the answer came; we, the ordinary citizens.
LDC_Translation_4: Then again asked, who are the enemies of religion and the country? Then came the answer: we, the citizens of this country'.

LDC_Translation_1: I don't know how the Pakistani army will fight against the Indian army when it could not control a small Taliban group.
LDC_Translation_2: I am surprised how the Pakistan army will fight with the Indian army when it cannot control a small group of Taliban.
LDC_Translation_3: I wonder how Pakistan army will fight against the Indian army when it cannot control a small group of the Taliban.
LDC_Translation_4: I am amazed. If the Pakistan Army cannot control a small group of Taliban, how would it fight a war with India? Army.

LDC_Translation_1: They could not track the Taliban's illegal FM channel, which I think should be very easy to do.
LDC_Translation_2: They could not track an illegally-run FM Channel of Taliban, which I think is very simple.
LDC_Translation_3: They cannot track down the illegal FM channel which I think is very easy to do.
LDC_Translation_4: They could not even track the illegally operated Taliban FM channel, which I believe is easy to track.

LDC_Translation_1: Even now this FM is spewing its venom with full force.
LDC_Translation_2: But still, it is spreading poisonous propaganda with full might.
LDC_Translation_3: Even then this FM is poisoning the airwaves with full force.
LDC_Translation_4: Even now, this FM channel is spitting fire with great fanfare.

LDC_Translation_1: After the girls' schools, now the boys' schools are being destroyed.
LDC_Translation_2: After girls schools, boys schools are now being destroyed.
LDC_Translation_3: After the girls schools, the boys schools are now being destroyed.
LDC_Translation_4: Boys' schools are being destroyed after closing down girls' schools.

LDC_Translation_1: A curfew is imposed to make it easy for the Taliban to move.
LDC_Translation_2: Curfew is imposed so as to facilitate the movement of Taliban.
LDC_Translation_3: The curfew is imposed so that the Taliban may easily move around.
LDC_Translation_4: A curfew is imposed so that Talibans can move easily from one place to another.

LDC_Translation_1: Tonight during the curfew, eight trucks entered the outskirts of Mingora during the curfew and made trenches.
LDC_Translation_2: Last night during curfew hours, they penetrated the suburbs of Mangora and made hideouts.
LDC_Translation_3: Tonight, during the curfew they came in 8 trucks and dug up trenches in the suburbs of Mingora.
LDC_Translation_4: Tonight, eight trucks barged into Mengura during curfew hours and created a front overnight.

LDC_Translation_1: The question that arises is how they managed to get there in spite of the curfew.
LDC_Translation_2: The question arises as to how they reached there during curfew hours.
LDC_Translation_3: The question is how they reached there in spite of the curfew.
LDC_Translation_4: The question is, how did they reach there during curfew?

LDC_Translation_1: The army can kill Akbar Bugti in his house, but it salutes the Taliban.
LDC_Translation_2: The army can kill Akbar Bugti in his house and salutes Talibans.
LDC_Translation_3: The army can kill Akbar Bugti in his home but salutes the Taliban.
LDC_Translation_4: The Army can kill Akbar Bagti in his house, and salutes the Taliban.

LDC_Translation_1: For Allah's sake, somebody make this army understand that they should get the helpless people of Swat out of the Taliban's grip and prove that the Pakistani army can overpower any enemy.
LDC_Translation_2: For God's sake, someone make this army understand to help free the defenseless people of Sawat out of the grips of the Taliban and prove that the Pakistan army can overpower any kind of enemy.
LDC_Translation_3: For God's sake, someone may explain to this army to liberate the powerless people of Swat from the clutches of Taliban and prove that the Pakistan army can overpower any enemy.
LDC_Translation_4: For Allah's sake, somebody make this army understand to remove the innocent people of Swat and prove that the Pakistan Army can beat any enemy.

LDC_Translation_1: The gentleman says, "Most of the blood in the world has been spilled on the basis of religions; tell me now, would there be all this killing if there were no religion?"
LDC_Translation_2: The respectable gentleman says that in the world, most of the bloodshed was caused by religion. You tell me if there had been no religion at all, had this bloodshed not happened.
LDC_Translation_3: His Highness says that most of the blood in the world has been shed in the name of religion. Tell me that if there had been no religion, would no bloodshed had taken place?
LDC_Translation_4: Hadrat said that religion has been the reason for all the bloodshed in the world. Tell me: if there were no religion, wouldn't there have been this bloodshed?
